Review_body: I watched The Big Lebowski a few nights ago with a handful of friends, one of which was a female.  During the film, I wondered if this was a film she could enjoy.  I do not know any female who has seen the film.  After, she told me she loved it.  I was taken aback by this comment and now I am thoroughly convinced that this is a great movie.  It would be impossible for me to give away any of the plot, considering that the plot is inexplicable. However, The Big Lebowski is a phenomenal comic mystery complete with cursing, bowling, unemployment, grand theft auto, a matter of one million dollars, and a toe...with nail polish.

Review title: My favorite movie of all time - a perfect movie
Review_body: If there was ever a perfect movie, it would be The Big Lebowski.  The Coen Brothers outdid themselves with this story about The Dude, an average joe who grew up in the 60's, likes the leaf, and loves to bowl.  Stealing the show are John Goodman as Walter the Vietnam vet and John Turturo as "The Jesus," a flamboyant Spanish pedophile.  Also making an appearance is Flea from the Red Hot Chili Peppers who makes a great techno-playing nihilist. But above all, there's The Dude, Jeff Bridges' most loveable character ever.To tie everything together we have the narration of The Stranger.  The best movie Ive ever seen and can watch it over and over again.

Review title: Most quotable film of all time
Review_body: "The Big Lebowski?"  Oh, isn't that the movie about the guy who justs walks around and smokes pot all day?"  People like that shouldn't be dignified with a response.  There's no use explaining the genuis behind this movie to someone of that caliber.  My friends and I were recently saying that this is one of the only movies where you can start it anywhere in the movie and watch it from there, there's not a dull moment to be found. Every actor is great, esp. Jeff Bridges and John Goodman.  Of course, they were overlooked for any awards.  Overall, this is the Coen brothers best work to date, and one day will get it's due.On a side note, was I the only one who noticed Jeff Bridges was wearing that same blue-sleeved baseball shirt in "The Fisher King?"

Review title: A truly remarkable story about guys bowling!
Review_body: When people talk about the Coen brothers movies such as Fargo and Raising Arizona are mentioned. I, however, see The Big Lebowski as their all time greatest.They have turned a story about a guy known as "The Dude" into a comedy masterpiece.The Big Lebowski is rather controversial in a way that you will either love it or find it dull and boring. Either way take the time to watch it and decide for your self. I promise you that you are to find at least one of the characters in this movie extremely funny.This is also one of these movies that are worth watching several times.Warning! Do not expect mind-boddling revelations on the meaning of life from this movie. Just sit back and enjoy two hours of truly original and at times hysterical comedy.

My favorite comedy of recent years. Filled with funny, quirky characters and situations as you'd expect from a Coen brothers movie, done with style. The hero -or anti-hero rather- "The Dude" Lebowski may not be a genius, but very likeable nonetheless. You got to love his attitude: While stumbling through a crime mystery apparently inspired by Chandler, Hammett and the like, he gets seriously drugged by a porn producer, is beaten up by a sheriff, threatened with losing his "Johnson", used as a sperm donor by a feminist/artist; and this list of mishaps is not even complete. But amidst all this he's able to smoke some reefers, drink a lot of White Russian cocktails -which I tried for the first time myself after seeing the film, I can recommend it- and go bowling with his friends. At the end someone even dies, but it's the character you least expected to...This is one of those rare movies, that get even better with each viewing. Two thumbs up!

This is by far the funniest movie I've seen in a long time.  It's also the most original and creative of the Coen Brothers' films.  If you like sarcastic humor, or flat-out violent in your-face comedy, I suggest this film.  Don't miss the hilarious scenes inside the character's local bowling alley, or John Goodman's hilarious performance, as a "Jewish" friend of the Dude.  My grade: 10/10

Review title: to know the Dude is to love the Dude
Review_body: A simply amazing film with definite cult status, I can watch this movie over and over, especially when I need to be picked up...it's one of those movies that makes you feel safe and comfortable, just because the Dude makes you feel like everything will work out fine. The movie is hilarious, and there are so many great quotes and characters. It is also one of the few films that makes me think LA might be a nice place to live. The music is excellent, the dream sequences are inspired. I enjoy most Coen brothers films, but this one is truly special. It has such a good flow to it. Often, when I really like a movie, I enjoy the first half hour or so more than the rest. This one is entertaining from start to finish. Jeff Bridges, whom I've often liked in films, has really made one of the greatest characters of all time. The Dude abides. Viva el Duderino!

Well, I thought I was till I nearly pi**ed my pants laughing the first time I saw TBL. And the second time..and the third... One of the things that kills me about this movie, and apparently no-one else sees, is the fact that the Dude is SO laid back that he rarely has a thought of his own. Three quarters of his dialogue is only him repeating something he picked up from someone else in the film. He even catches himself almost repeating something he doesn't mean to..."And stay away from my special lad...my f***in lady friend". Did anyone notice what he was wearing in the "Gutterballs" dream sequence? It's the same thing 'Carl Hungus' has on in the "Logjammin'" porn video. The whole plot is motivated by the Dude being influenced by everyone else (mostly Sobchak) and he just floats along with it. Not until near the end when he realizes "My thinking about this 'case' has become very uptight" and actually figures things out for himself, does he really guide his own destiny. I must have watched it 10 times before I caught everything, lot of ins, lot of outs, lot of what what have yous. Lot of strands in the Duder's head. The best comedy of all time, hands down.

Review title: perhaps, one of the greatest comedies of all time. . .
Review_body: a magnificently well-thought out comedy that draws its material from philosophy, politics, and bowling.  the brothers follow a seemingly apathetic character who refers to himself as "the dude, or your dudeness, or el duderino if your not down with the whole brevity thing" as he unwillingly becomes responsible for the life of the missing trophy-wife of a wealthy cripple who shares the same last name as the dude. . .lebowski.  rather than relying on simple fart jokes and sight gags this comedy revolves around the question of how one is expected to behave in modern american society and how one exists when one no longer considers oneself to be a member of society. the protagonist is an outsider, a contradiction to the values of the politics that surround him and our willingness to embrace him is the core of this wonderful film.

This is a great movie. Or you love it or you hate it. The thing with The Big Lebowski is that the whole story isn't that important. It's all about the weird characters and the conversations. Plus that it has a great soundtrack and the you get to see the nicest shots of the beautiful game of bowling (even viewed from inside of a ball).It's about this guy named the Dude(Bridges) whose real name is Lebowski , that usually hangs at the Bowling with the crazy Vietnam-veteran Walter (Goodman) who screws up everything, and the shy little guy named Donny (Buscemi!). The Dude comes home after another day of bowling and finds 2 guys in his house that are after a Lebowski, but after a little brainstorming they realize that this isn't the rich Lebowski they were looking for. Before leaving,one of the intruders, the 'Chinaman', urinates on the Dude's rug. The rug that really tied his room together. But the Dude is gonna do something about it ('This aggression will not stand, man).The next day Dude decides to go to the Lebowski they were looking for to report the incident, and to maybe get some money for a new rug. This is the beginning of a hilarious 'adventure', with very funny scenes.
See this masterpiece by the brothers Coen and laugh your head off.You can watch it more than once.

The first Coen brothers' movie I saw was "Fargo" and, to be frank, I didn't enjoy it very much the first time. The experience with "The Big Lebowski" was more or less the same. Fortunately, I watched it a second time before I returned the DVD and... my life changed. I immediately started building my own personal Coen brothers' collection (starting with, of course, The Big Lebowski). I have easily seen this movie more than a hundred times by now. In fact, I can replay the entire movie in my head if I need to!Some general suggestions for Coen newcomers: You have to allow yourself to be transported into the "Coens' World" before you can fully appreciate their movies. The guys have a quirky worldview and a rather twisted sense of humour. They also have a gift for writing fast, funny, quotable dialogue.Transporting one's self to the Coens' world isn't very hard: this can be accomplished by watching, for example, The Big Lebowski about 2-3 times (say within ten days).What you will get out of this movie: Several memorable quotes which will be a source of endless amusement throughout your life. And, if you watch it often enough, you'll also end up leading a more "relaxed" and enjoyable life. A word of warning: Don't overdo it! Overexposure may well diminish your enjoyment of the movie. (I'd say that 20 is a safe enough number of times that you can watch this movie. And then maybe you can continue to watch once or twice a year for pretty much the rest of your life.))Everything I wish to say about this movie has already been said and been said better. (If you're already an "achiever", do read other users' comments, they are great!) If you were waiting for one more recommendation before you rent it, here it is: Watch it! (Hopefully you'll like it as much as I did.)

I'll try not to repeat what has been said in other reviews, but this is a special movie for me.  I had gone through a very painful breakup and I was utterly miserable for two months.  One night, I rented this movie (seeing it for the second time), I laughed my fool head off, and things got better again.  Perhaps The Dude's final line in the movie (which I won't give away) provided me with hope and perspective. This is one of those rare comedies that just keeps getting funnier every time you see it.  Jeff Bridges, who is so good at intense, brooding roles, has unbelievable comic timing here. Some criticize the plot as overly meandering, and it is.  But the film's aura is compelling, and you just want to go along for the ride.Like some other Coen Brothers films, The Big Lebowski takes the archetypes of a particular genre and spins them in an utterly unique way.  All of the staples of the film noir detective story are here:  the LA setting, the kidnapping, the aristocratic client, the easily enraged sidekick, the femme fatale, the miscreants and lowlifes who impede the progress of the case, etc.  However, the lead is not someone with  an unwavering sense of purpose as is usual, but the role is instead filled by The Dude, quite possibly the laziest person in the world.  As the expression goes, hilarity ensues. Since this is the Coen Bros., the humor is obviously not like most modern comedies in which vapid characters say and do stupid things in predictable ways.  The Big Lebowski keeps you off balance with loads of witty dialogue, plot twists, and gags that absolutely blindside you.  Seeing The Big Lebowski will make your life better.  Unless of course, you end up not liking the movie.

Review title: A dude gets involved in a kidnapping mystery when he is mistaken for a like-named millionaire.
Review_body: If you're not one to be offended by a lot of swearing, you can't afford to miss this movie.  I've never laughed so much, or found so much quotable material in one picture as I did in The Big Lebowski.  If you haven't seen it, do.  If you have seen it, let's go bowling.

Review title: He was the man for his time and place.
Review_body: Not a viewing goes past that I don't laugh at this movie. Whether it be the rammblings of Walter, the constant drug referances, or the Jesus. I can't say much about this film, surprisingly enough. All I can say is this: It has more of a complex plot than you think, it has a distinctive style, and gives more than a few laughs. Try it out sometime, dude.

Review title: Funny Movie with a little bit of depth
Review_body: This movie is hilarious, the casting in this movie couldnt have been more perfect.  Jeff bridges does a great job as the "DUDE" a pot head from the 70's who doesnt seem to do much but bowl, and "have the occasional acid flash back".  The dude then gets caught up in a kidnapping and him and his buddies have to figure out what to do. I recommend this movie to people who are not offended by vulgar language and are in the mood for a good hearted movie about buddies

Review title: Big Lebowski unfairly treated by many
Review_body: I have seen this fine film numerous times, and still find it to be a hilarious piece of cinema. However, many of my friends and associates continue to insist that the Big Lebowski is a waste of time. Most of these people have not even bothered to watch the movie a second time. It is not until seeing it again that the movie does not make sense. I urge anyone who has seen this movie once, to rent it, and watch it again, it will be worth it. And if you haven't seen it, rent it, and watch it twice... If anyone has met resistance when preaching the creamy goodness of the Big Lebowski, please contact me.

Review title: Lie back watch it and then you'll get it.
Review_body: this movie may be called the wisdom of the dude. it reminds me the book of "The Tao of Pooh".the dude is a guy that floats with the stream,he is not trying to be the most smart guy on earth,the bravest and so on.he is just the dude.and for once with the "help" of his Vietnam veteran,Walter,he is trying to be smart and things start mess up for him.but even then he is still the dude.the good thing about watching the movie is a chance to take a rest from the rat race of life,lean back,eat popcorn with a beverage and have a good time...just like the dude.and if you learn something from that movie ...then it would be something that with no words...it is something that you will grasp with your feelings and gut. no brain and mind is needed here...and no unnecessary words.have a good time.

Review title: A bizarre, superb, disturbing, hilarious cult classic
Review_body: My friends and I have seen this several times and we agree that it is a dark comedy up there with Dr. Strangelove.  It has elements of greatness on so many levels that are not apparent at first. The bad box office turn-outs were easily overshadowed by its popularity in rental and VHS/DVD sales, very similar to what happened to a lot of great movies, such as "Blade Runner".Essentially this film, in a nutshell, is about a slacker in the early nineties whom, in the first several minutes, is beaten up by two thugs in his own home, one of which soils his rug, then realizing that they kicked the proverbial 'crap' out of the wrong guy, they leave.  This slacker (Lebowski), goes on an odyssey to find the men who saturated his carpet, which ultimately gets him mixed up in a kidnapping case involving German nihilists trying to cut off his genitalia, including a late night bathroom attack by a trained attack marmot.Lots of memorable scenes, characters (Such as Jesus, the perverted bowler), and very twisted humor, some of which may be considered offensive, seeing as a scant several scenes features brief nudity.It's symbolic for society, some might say, as the Big Lebowski is a very 'achieved' man, where as, the hero, the Little Lebowski, is a foulmouthed slacker, but in the end, through confusion, the Little Lebowski turns out to have been taken advantage of.A four star comedy.

Review title: Black Humour at its very blackest
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is probably one of the best films in the category of dark comedy. The Coen brothers did a really magnificent job in all respects. Practically every aspect of the movie is flawless. The characters, the dialogues, the casting, the storyline, the settings and the plot itself. Where the main roles are concerned Jeff Bridges and John Goodman gave their best performance ever. The roles suite them so well, I doubt they will ever do better than they did here. Steve Buscemi is the only exception (he already gave his best in Fargo)Unfortunately, the Coen brothers never really recovered after the shock of making such an exquisite film and their later works are nowhere near as good. In fact I'd go as far as to say their film Intolerable Cruelty (2003) was a complete waste of effort, for maker and viewer alike.There is however one emphatic point about the Big Lebowski: it is not universal humour. To really appreciate it, one has to be familiar with the American way of life or at least have a basic understanding of US history, contemporary culture, slang and so on. For example the ambiance of the "bowling culture", words like "undude", "bummer", "jay", "ringer" "His Dudeness"; Walter's (Goodman) constant struggle for people to respect his constitutional rights and the RULES etc. Overall I still have to say it is an evergreen classic, and a must see for everyone who believes they have a decent sense of humour and are not put off by a little cursing from time to time and let's face it: all the time.

Review title: One of The Best Comedy Ever
Review_body: I'm a Coen Brothers fan, so when I See "The Big Lebowski" in DVD, I Bought It. I wasn't old enough to understand this film when It came on Theater so I didn't see It. Now I had the opportunity to do. Final Results : It's a pure wonderful achievement by The Coen Brothers.The Screenplay : The story is very original,the characters live in a very confusing L.A (Maybe it's like that) and they are very wealthy and varied, "The Dude", "The Big Lebowski", "The Nihilist"... All these characters are different and when they collide it make very special situations. These situations are varied too, like the places. This is not a film with just two or three places, we can see very different places of L.A.The acting : Just one of the most hilarious performances I've ever seen. Jeff Bridges was the only one to play "The Dude", with his long hair and some pounds more he's unrecognizable but not his performance. And John Goodman I think gave his most memorable performance, even the small supporting roles are good too (Steve Buscemi, John Turturoo).The Directing : Coens Classic, They interesting about there characters, even there isn't a lot of close shot, the "high states" of "The Dude" are pretty good, without using a lot of special effects, like this they make the scenes more realistic, it's a comedy film not a sci-fi movie.Conclusion : A excellent comedy with great performances.And don't forget : "The Dude" stays up

Absolutely unwatchable. Tried it twice, figuring one attempt wasn't sufficient.I am not offended by vulgar language, but when it is such a major portion of the dialogue, it had better be with good reason and to great effect. Neither is the case, here.These characters are the types of people that normal people with lives pass by numerous times a day without taking any notice. There is a reason for that. Folks like that are uninspiring, dull, and generally useless to the world they inhabit. Centering a movie script on them is going to make you a dolt or a genius, depending how sycophantic your fan base is. It seems too many people checked their good judgment at the door - not only giving this movie a free pass, but pumping up the votes to the extent that this turd rates in the Top 250. Whoa geez.Again, I say, "Absolutely unwatchable."

Review title: Possibly the greatest comedy ever. A true gem.
Review_body: As far as I'm concerned this is easily the very best movie the incredible Coen brothers have made to date. Comedy is one of the most difficult, demanding genres around, and in order for it to work it must be made with a professionalism that exceeds all imagination.  Now that's one of the many great things about "The Big Lebowski". Everything in this movie is sheer genius, every detail is right, and the timing is perfect, but it feels so laidback you hardly notice the brilliance and skill.What else can I say ? The Dude is just about the coolest main character you can possibly imagine, and he's surrounded by a hilarious troupe of supporting characters that make this film a truly worthwile event. Walter Sobchak, Donnie, the three nihilists, the Jesus, Maude, Jackie Treehorn, Brandt, Knox Harrington ... they're all hysterically funny.  Same goes for the nonsensical situations The Dude gets into. The first appereance of the Jesus, the farret scene, the toilet scene ("Where's the money Lebowski ?"), the confrontation on the parking lot, the money handover, the beach scene, and so many more wonderful moments - I'll kick myself for not mentioning them later... they can make anyone with a sense of humour howl with laughter, again and again and again.The cast is tremendous: Jeff Bridges is in my opinion one of the best American actors around and as The Dude, he finally got the chance to show what a remarkable comedian he really is. John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, John Turturro, Julianne Moore, Philip Seymour Hoffman... each and every one of them gives a new meaning to the word "delicious".In short, this movie is such a feast of wonderful dialogues, hilarious characters and unbelievably funny scenes it's already a true classic. The Dude abides, man, The Dude abides...

Review title: The Coen Brothers made another Cult-Movie
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is the best Comedyfilm, I have ever seen! The Dude is such a looser- unbelievable. ..and how happy he is, when he may take of his clothes at the doctor. The dream sequences in the film are really good too. The best thing is when the Dude and Walter are trying do bring the money for Bunny Lebowski. But why are the Germans shown in such a strange way? ;-( Doesn`t matter - GREAT FILM!!!

I'd been nagged by friends and colleagues for years to watch this movie, face-palms all around - they couldn't believe I hadn't seen one of the best movies of all time.I have a 30min rule for movies, if it's rubbish I turn it off to avoid wasting my life on a bad movie. As this one came with such a high regard, I gave it a full hour and then was forced to turned it off.Don't ask me how it ended, it was so dull and boring I really don't care. It was slow, I found myself falling asleep and I've never before watched a comedy with no laughs. Reading the other reviews, I wonder if we were watching the same movie.I watched "Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li" earlier this year just for fun as it had such poor reviews and ratings. Sadly I enjoyed it more than this "classic". Whoever invented the "dark comedy" genre should be put against a wall and shot.

This movie really tops all other comedy's. From the opening scene, the dude in his morning robe in the supermarket, the old fashioned telephone which keeps on ringing. Every line in this movie is one to remember and every character is so good it makes you smile if you think about them. And it's a movie which get's better with every viewing. I find humor so much better if it's so dry you keep wondering if you should laugh out loud or implode...What to say, you've got to see this. More then once!

After watching the heavenly film The Big Lebowski, I realized that no matter how hard life is, there's always The Dude that makes our lives so simple. It's good knowin' he's out there. Takin' 'er easy for all us sinners. The Dude is some sort of a divine creature, a representative of god on earth. characters like Donny (aka shut the f*** up Donny)and Walter made me think that maybe life is not all about money, cars and clothes. It's about those little moments of happiness when you hit a strike or have an IN & OUT burger. Maybe that's what life is all about.

10 pinning and the occasional acid flashback.When I saw this movie for the first time I was flabbergasted. It was quite simply the funniest movie I'd ever seen... It still is! The C Bros. have once again pulled it off: a masterpiece.The dialogue is second to none and John S. Lyons should have won innumerable awards for his unprecedented casting job! Sure I've met people who didn't like it... But then again I've also met people who didn't care for Roger & Me. I guess we're just on separate planets.The Dude, Walter Sobchak, Donny Karabozoz and the rarely appearing Jesus Quintana are gut splittingly hilarious and the essence of working class heroes! I love'um!Since I fist saw this gem I've bought the movie, the soundtrack and a pair of clear plastic sandals!I rate it supreme...

Review title: sometimes there's a man, well, he's just the man for his time and place
Review_body:
Hilarious. The Coen brothers put together a comic gem involving Jeff `The Dude' Lebowski, played masterfully by Jeff Bridges, as an un-employed, white-russian sipping bum who, only wanting retribution for his soiled rug, stumbles into a kidnapping-ransom scenario that has several twists and turns. Along for the ride are Walter (John Goodman), his high-strung Vietnam veteran bowling buddy, Maude (Julianne Moore), the ultra-feminist daughter of another Jeff Lebowski (this one a millionaire, and who's wife it is that is kidnappedif this sounds a bit confusing, well, just watch the movie and it'll all make sense), a pornstar, and a group of nihilists. Oh, and John Turturro is uproarious as Jesus, Walter and Dude's bowling rival.
What makes this movie so good is not the story itself, but rather how the hapless Dude and Walter stumble around, changing allegiances and theories as to what happened to the `Big' Lebowski's wife (again, just watch the movie). The back-and-forths between Walter, the Dude, and Donny (their 3rd bowling partner) are wonderfully written and delivered. The dream sequences are great (Saddam Hussein handing out bowling shows? Priceless) and the soundtrack is excellent. This movie is a classic among college and high school guys, and I'm sure you'll realize why when you see it. All in all, a well written, acted, directed, and funny film.

Review title: How on earth is this funny?
Review_body: I've read about 100 comments on this film and didn't find any negative ones. To me that's very weird since this film only has about 5 memorable laughs.You can predict every single joke miles ahead, the one with the ash in 'dudes' face at the top spot.Then that guy dies in the end.. what about that? I didn't feel any connection to any of the characters, so I couldn't care less..This film could be funny when you're high on weed, but everything is funny then.If you're looking for stupid practical joke stuff, watch this. Otherwise don't ever bother and watch a Friends rerun instead. Even that is more funny when you watch it for the tenth time.

Review title: never let a marmot share your bathtub
Review_body: a magical farago of comical mishaps.perhaps one of the best pieces of sustained anarchy ever.the scene involving The Dude&the cricket bat wielding enforcers as they throw the marmot on him as he lies soaking is surely one of the alltime clasics. A must-see if you you like your humour raw.

Review title: Worst movie I have ever seen!
Review_body: I have just written one review, but this awful movie deserves one. This is absolutely incredible, but seems that lots of people liked it! I did not found anything funny in it, nor action, nor story, nor the way the story is told, nor the script that is horrible. This is a flat movie without any depth, the most superficial movie I have ever seen. You simply can't find any knowledge nor inspiration, nor entertainment in it. It is a great black hole, you'll only spend time watching it. There is no way to found something interesting in this movie. Except some seconds in a bowling scene, I can't find any interesting point of interest in this movie. And the hilarious part is that it was recommended to me by two friends of mine. There is something wrong in this world that I am not aware about.

Review title: Sometimes confusing plot saved by great characters and quality writing
Review_body: The first Coen brothers film I saw was 'Fargo'. That was a great film, if a little short. Then I saw this. Now, when I first watched this I expected a gory, dark film like 'Fargo'. What I got surprised me. This film was quite mellow and laid back for the Coens, at least in terms of sheer, gory violence. But then the plot went off in all sorts of directions and at times became confusing but one thing remained noticable, The sheer quality of the writing and the great acting. The Dude is a warm, lovable fool who just wants to live his life and not have people mess it up. For me what made the dude such a great lead character was the quality performance from Jeff Bridges. The way in which he makes the dude appear confused but also clever is totally believeable. For me the dude was one of the most likeable heroes since Vincent Vega in Pulp Fiction. As good as Bridges is as the dude one actor outshines him. John Goodman as Walter. Walter is a mentalist but also a good man and Goodman manahes to portray this with ease. IMO this is his best performance to date. Of course no film would be complete without quality dialogue and The big Lebowski has this in spades. For all the profanity there is real meaning and thought gone into the writing and it helps give character to the characters in much the same way that Glengarry Glen Ross' writing did.

I found that while I liked certain parts of the film and found the acting excellent. It just seemed uneven in pace and plot......however...Five days later, I found himself quoting lines from the movie and laughing to myself about many of the scenes. Call it the "slow-burn effect", it just gets better with age. It was a much better film than I though it was when I first saw it. However, it is a 8-9 star movie. But since I didn't realize it in the beginning while I viewed it, I had to dock it a couple of stars. Definitely part of the Cohen Canon. This is a Good Thing. I don't roll on Shabbos!!

Review title: What makes this film so brilliant?
Review_body: If someone would ever pitch this film to me in a universe where I had not seen this film, I would've probably thought of it like a small, peculiar little film, that probably would've had my interest, but with not much more going for it. Never would I have conscidered a film like that be that kind of a film I would conscider one of my personal top ten favorite films of all time. So what is it that makes it so lovable? To be honest, I didn't truly get it the first time I saw it, that can be because how young I was the first time I saw it. I have though grown very fond of it later on, for now to be conscidered one of my all time favorites, and I think it has all to do with the deliverance. The acting is great, the scenario is ridiculous and the plot is overly complicated, yet that's the reason the film works that well. I am the type of person who loves roundedness in storytelling, where conflicts are resolved in a peculiar manner. This film offers this in a sense, yet also not at all. I was very confused about the ending the first time I saw the film because there are several story lines that are never further explored as the credits roll. I didn't really like this way to end the film the first time I saw it, but I have realized over the time how brilliant it really is. First of all because of our main character, Jeffrey "The Dude" Lebowski. We are following his story, yet as all of our stories, it will include the story of others. Throughout the film we meet sorts of different people, whom The Dude has something to do with, we get a glimpse of their stories, but not the resolution of them, this may be because it's not something The Dude actually cares about, because the rest of those stories are not something that involves him. To quote the dude, quoting Lenin; "You look for the person who will benefit, and, uh, you know what I'm trying to say."

Review title: Whatever you rate this film is how well you fit into the world.
Review_body: Whatever you rate this film is how well you fit into the world.

This is a rare gem. The most original, hilarious, and unforgettable movie I've ever seen.The Big Lebowski is not a movie with a straight forward plot. It is not a movie that is going to give you closure. And if you don't pay attention, most of it won't be all that funny. But if you sit and watch, soak it all up, and allow yourself to get lost in nothing, it is a one of a kind experience. Please watch this movie, remember the one liners, and become one with the dude.

You hardly could expect more from a movie. There is a great script, with great characters, some of them (Walter) might remain forever in the story of Hollywood. Nice cinematography, specially some clips related about bowling. Nice music, too. Also wonderful performances of Bridges, Goodman and Buscemi, but among all of them, John Goodman(Walter again) raises to the top.But overall, this is an hilarious comedy, a great collection of laughs. It won't change your live, but it could (surely will) make it much funnier for a while. 8/10 (I only give 9 or 10 to things like Citizen Kane and the lot). Sorry about my english.

Review title: Zen for Boomers: Lebowski as the Anti-Hero
Review_body: Apart from its burgeoning cult status, this film is seriously overlooked and underrated. Perhaps partially the result of gross marketing misrepresentation. Regardless, you know how there are some films that strike such a cord that you tend to believe you can effectively use them to screen potential friends and lovers? This is such a film for me. Excellent script, generation-defining philosophy (both Boomers and Xers tend to like it the most in my experience) tempered with humor, unforgettable characters and performances exquisitely produced. My favorite film of the Coen brothers' offerings and in my top ten of anyone else's. Great soundtrack, to boot.

I am thinking to myself "what are you people watching?" for those who found this film in the slightest funny. This was bad, just plain bad. The only positive comment I would have is with Turturro's character. He is the sole standout. I found myself getting very upset and hating Bridges' and Goodman's characters. If this was the directors' motivation, then they succeeded big time. I think that the actors - Buscemi, Turturro, and Hoffman - all got lulled into a false sense by the success of the directors previous film - Fargo. What a shame and bad move. The film totally misses its point of being this off-beat quirky comedy. I can't say it enough, it was painful watching Goodman's character say the same stupid line to Buscemi – over and over. A complete waste of time.
I can't believe the ratings. This is so bad. If you like cursing and childish humor, this is for you.

Review title: I love movies that hold together this well while at the same time being totally unpredictable
Review_body: Easily one of my favorite movies, by my favorite actor. I've always like Jeff Bridges, but he usually plays someone fairly together and knowing exactly where he's going and how he's going to get there: here, he may be together in a unique sort of way, but he has no idea where he's going and he doesn't care how he gets where ever he's going. Just going' with the flow.As with so many great movies, every character is a gem, and even actors I don't normally like are excellent.When I first watched this movie, I was in a room with my extended family (wife, in-laws, my in-laws in-laws) and within 10 minutes, all but three of us had left the room, overwhelmed by the swearing and a bit disgusted with this character with no apparent redeeming features. Besides my brother-in-law and myself, my brother-in-law's 80-year old Jewish mother-in-law stayed. At the end of the movie we had all laughed a lot, but the best line was reserved for "bubby" who said "I've never heard the word f___ used in so many interesting ways".

Text: I will not say much about this thing, but this is a movie with the most idiot brainless characters and the most silly meaningless dialogues i've ever seen in my life. That's all i can say about it, just a lousy thing no more. This movie was made in the nineties, the decade with the most wonderful movies ever made and yet there are some people still like it!!!! Ok maybe i came from another planet, but again this movie is just a piece of Nothing but bull@#*# and a completely waste of time.

Its a really good, tricky to understand, filled with hidden meaning, slightly funny, kinda sad, psychological, Coen Brothers piece of art.The only reason I give it an 8 is that at the end of the day its too simple when you boil all the complex stuff, and once you do you will realize that you could have watched far better moves/shows if you wanted to think about all the themes in the movie. Hell I'd rather watch 2-3 episodes of Supernatural episodes rather than this and get the same thoughts and feelings. But that's why I am giving it a 8 rating, out of respect for the Coen brothers and the people who will enjoy this stuff more than me. I can easily get bored with movies/shows that have normal life representations of more complex meanings.

Review title: Very optimistic, perfectly chill outing and just great pastiche of detective movie!
Review_body: Joel and Ethan Coen - well known post-modernists, the most famous next to Quentin Tarantino, masters in conventions's jugglery, the only Hitchcock's successors in the field of suspense (for example "Barton Fink") once again had a fling at viewer. Once again we are dealing with film labyrinth full of citations, conventions and misleads. Brothers, like always, in masterly way changing conventions, and all of that - accumulation of extremely funny scenes and episodes, funny and witty dialogs and loony characters - drowns in smoke of absurdity. The movie is made - like every Coens production - very shipshape: cinematography (of genial Roger Deakins), production design and set decoration (also great Dennis Gassner) and acting. In the movie we can enjoy such great leading actors as Julianne Moore, Jeff Bridges (his BEST role), great characteristic actors like Steve Buscemi, John Goodman or John Turturro and also masters in supporting like Philip Seymour Hoffman. Important fact is that characters played by Bridges, Goodman, Buscemi and Turturro were written SPECIALLY for THESE actors.

Am I the only one who NEVER saw this film when it was first released...yet EVERYONE else was hailing it as the best film EVER....
so when I did get chance to see it...
I must have then been the only one to think "hang on...is this really it?"
I thought it was terrible.....truly terribleso yeah..maybe I am the only one
waste of 2 hours - 2 hours that I would never get back.
so disappointed with it - especially with all the hype around it.

Review title: Lot of strands to keep in my head, man
Review_body: This is one of the best movies, on so many levels. I didn't pick up on how mean this movie is, the first few times I watched it. Jeff Bridges as The Dude is kind of infinitely charismatic, so it's hard to see through to all the really fucked up stuff. He constantly repeats things that other people have said to him, he has a pretty aggressive sense of entitlement, he is a dick to women, and he only seems vaguely sane in contrast to Walter. His solution to all problems is bowling. He doesn't seem to do much of anything besides be a real chill ass dude. Which is hilarious and fun to watch. It is a great movie. I just love the fact that I can find a new layer, three viewings in, and then that makes me want to watch it again, to see if it's right. Fuckin good movie.

Review title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen!
Review_body: The film is extremely tiring, with dialogues without any content and I only managed to have a laugh at the whole film ... One of the most highly esteemed films of all time, those who watch will understand what I'm talking about

The Big Lebowski was a movie where going in all I knew was that it was a comedy, and it is definitely a hilarious movie. The story itself is what is so confusing, how nothing really matters and you just follow this plotline that was linear yet infrequent with seemingly random things occurring. The whole point of this is to satire crime dramas while also giving you some easy laughs mixed with the deep ones.

Hilarious performances from Jeff bridges and especially john goodman. Telling the story of slacker Jeff lebowski, this movie will make you die laughing. Plenty of random, stupid, hilarious moments. Watch it dude!
This movie... Is one of the greatest movies ever made. It is a masterpiece. That's all, go check it out, dude. I'll now have a White Russian.

I have seen the Big Lebowski numerous times and each time it only gets better.  This has to be Jeff Bridges' best role, and he was flawless.  John Goodman, was also amazing.  Essentially, the Coen brothers are making it happen 24 hours a day, churning out great movies, and the insane style of this movie cannot be overlooked as pure genius!

Review title: Like, this is just my opinion, man
Review_body: This picture is just grand, man.  But, like, that's just my opinion, dude. It's all about the rug.  It tied the whole movie together, man.  And what's a Coen brothers film without a rich man behind a desk, and a few weird dream sequences...man?  Nods to Bridges and especially Goodman.

Review title: Once again, the Cohen Brothers kick ass!!
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is yet another great film by the Coen brothers.  It's not quite as entertaining as "Fargo" or "Barton Fink", but it will not disappoint.  (In my opinion, the worst of their films towers above all the mediocre crud that's out there).  The dreamy bowling sequences were hilariously brilliant and most of the actors involved were excellent.  John Goodman, however,  was slightly annoying, and not nearly as effective as he was in "Barton Fink".  John Turturo was also great in a small role as Jesus the bowler.  See this film...
If you have ever felt guilty for being too lazy wait until you see this movie and meet the Dude, the laziest man in Los Angeles. A movie filled with a great sense of humor if you are smart.

Review title: Identical to the finnish Uuno Turhapuro films
Review_body: I think this film is a plagiate. At least the films whole idea is. In Finland there is an exactly similar serie of films called Uuno Turhapuro. This guy is called Uuno Turhapuro and hes kind of a whacko like Lebowski. They both have unfriendly father in laws. Well in Big Lebowski the dude didnt marry Maude like Uuno who married for money and made his father in law crazy.. His father in law was a finnish minister and the wheelchair guy is filthy rich important figure. Also Uuno has two crazy and weird friends like the dude. Also the plot is always something funny and a bit nuts just like in Big Lebowski. If you like Big Lebowski or are a big fan of it I recommend the Turhapuro series for you. While this serie of films is not so widely known internationally its creator Pertti Pasanen was a real genius of entertainment and Uuno Turhapuro series are a marvelous creation.
Has some mildly funny moment, but no laugh-out-loud bits.The plot is overly convoluted.
Great movie. I've seen it many times, and every time I'm bouncing. Congratulations to all involved in the production of this movie.

This is such a beautiful movie, to my opinion certainly the best the Coen brothers made. For anybody who sometimes gets tired of the hectic life he lives, this is a must see. It will make you want to be like the Dude. Because whatever happens, the Dude will be the Dude.This movie was made with a moving subtlety, although I must admit I didn't see that at first. It makes anything that takes itself too seriously look stupid, it's a manifest of Dudeness. The actors in this movie must have had incredible synergy when this movie was made. Without exceptions, the acting is really phenomenal. Especially Jeff Bridges (the Dude himself) John Goodman (Walter) and Philip Seymour Hoffman (Brandt) do amazing jobs. This movie, through excellent storytelling and acting, shows such a comforting humanity, it's warm and moving on many occasions. And it's hilarious at the same time.In the end, we learn that the Dude abides. And I don't know about you, but like the Stranger, I take comfort in that. The Dude abides.

I have seen many comedies and to rate a comedy will be hard because there are not too many good comedies its rarely you can laugh trough a whole movie but this is a comedy to see!and Its rare to find a comedy that has the rating 9 but this movie is anines! When you seen this movie you want to watch it over and over and over again.. Jeff bridges is so good as the dude and you will find the character so cool you want to be him.he represents how a unemployed can be a good thing.Goodman is almost as funny as Jeff is with his aggressive character.you don't want to miss when he get angry! as for recommendations:Go see it if you like comedy's this is the movie that will make you laugh almost every second trough the movie! VERY FUNNY MOVIE TO ENJOY!!!!
I watched this with my Dad and it was absolutely hilarious, and I know the Coen brothers always rate this #1 but I thought it was a little bit sexual so I wouldn't recommend it for small children!

Rarely do I watch a movie more than 3 or 4 times. I have watched The Big Lebowski at least 27 times in the past three years; it's just that good. Mind bending twists that are shadowed in an "I don't care" attitude make for some truly hilarious scenes. The energy between Jeff Bridges and John Goodman is natural, polar and just plain fun to watch. John Turtorro and Steve Buscemi also add flair to the picture in their supporting roles. The humor in this film is subtle at times; I'm still catching gags that I have not seen before. This is the mark of true genius on the part of the Coen brothers. If you are considering renting this movie, don't. Buy it! You will want to watch it over and over.  If I did not love it so much, I would not have required all of my employees to watch it. This way, when we were in a meeting and one of them would say "eight year olds, Dude," we all knew what he was talking about. Get the movie!

This movie is simply great.  Watch it again, since it's probably been a month or two since you last saw it.  What can be said that hasn't already, other than to comment on the unfortunate (but hilarious) alteration made to the dialogue for the TV-friendly clean edit; when Walter destroys the Corvette in what he thinks is retaliation for the disappearance of The Dude's car, he bellows "this is what you get when you fight a stranger in the Alps."  Fans of the film will recall instantly what this line replaces.The Cohen Brothers are in top form on this one.  Too bad Intolerable Cruelty didn't quite deliver.

Review title: More Then It Appears To Be
Review_body: People view the Big Lebowski as a screwball type comedy that is as heavy on the laughs as it is on the vulgarity.  But there is so much more there. I view this movie as the quinticential Coen Brothers movie because everything they have done in the past is in the movie.  There of course is a large helping of thier special brand of humor that seems to appeal to everybody.  There is a bit of drama from movies such as Millers Crossing, and then there are the thrills that the produced in Fargo.What most people don't see is that it is a modern twist to the classic Film Nor movies.  Watch the classics -The Maltesse Falcon, Chinatown, even the Coen's own Blood Simple- and you will see how much The Big Lebowski has in common with these movies.  I think that if you took Sam Spade out of the '40s and put him in the '90s you would have Jeff Lebowski.  Other common elements the movies all contain is the wide variety of characters, the problem is never solved to the viewers satisfaction, and you can't help but feel for the detective no matter how slimey and shady he is. So I urge you to take another look at this movie and don't just look for laughs but also look for the sheer brilliance of the Coen Brothers because who but they could hide a classic in a comedy.

Review title: One of the worst movies I had ever seen!
Review_body: It's not a comedy or sport or even anything it's the worst movie i had ever seen in my life it's not funny or anything it's not even a movie

Just saw this movie for the first time. It was absolutely rubbish. I litteraly laughed 1 time. Great names and great reviews so i give it a chance.Don't waste your time. Don't believe the reviews. I never fell asleep while i'm watching a movie. With these movie my eyes was starting to burn. Just because it was do damn boring.A lot of swear words and offended language and none comedy. 2 hours long it feels like they do the same thing over and over again. That was the longest 2 hours in my entire life.

Review title: Overrated, No plot, Not Funny, what more can I say
Review_body: I was drawn into this film by the cast and ratings. The reviews seemed great so it seemed worth watching.After trying to watch this twice before I decided to give it one last chance. God, no wonder I gave up on it twice already.After a fairly promising opening after about 10 minutes this film just drags on with no real storyline, countless child like unfunny jokes. It doesn't get going and just cuts to scenes of middle aged men in a ten pin bowling alley, discussing and preparing for a game like they're playing Premier League football.Definitely one of the worst films ever made.

This movie is an experience as you see the world through the dude's perspective. To some the story is nonsensical and none have satisfactory conclusions, but that is how the protagonist sees these stories and he did not care for how they ended and neither should we. Not for everyone, but that's why I love it!
A movie you can watch over and over again with it never getting old. A comedy masterpiece.

BEST COMEDY EVER MADE!!! SIMPLE AS THAT!!!
Great story, great characters, great performances, ALSO ONE OF THE MOST UNDERRATED MOVIES EVER!!

Without a doubt, the best movie ever made.  Funny as hell, lots of smokin', drinkin', cussin' and bowlin'.  Donnie, you're out of your element.  Are you employed, sir?  If not, rent this movie immediately and watch it all week. If you do have a job, watch it after work.  Haven't you heard?  Your war is over, Mr. Lebowski! The bums lost!  Well, I've had enough of this movie review.  Mind if I do a J?

A rare treat lies within TBL, The coen's deliver a witty, smart and at times political; but it is the mix of their chosen language which all the characters in all their films share, added with brilliant acting TBL will remain a memorable and special film. If you lack knowledge of the 'Fargo' makers or have yet to see a film by the Coen i worn not to approach TBL due to it's different but outstanding way of delivering a story, from the cool camera Angles to the unexpected but valid ending. TBL will stick with the viewer in mind for days and in heart for its characters (The Dude et al), dialogue, monologues, direction, originality and it's one and only story.I hope that the Coens remain in the High class because every film i have seen of theirs i have loved. So Raise a "White Russian" to the creators and enjoy an Unique, unpredictable and unforgettable film.----Cheers Coens!

I saw this movie in the late 90ties. My bigger brother, Tommy, had bought it.At first i did not think the movie was funny at all. I thought it was just a very weird film, about guys bowling. There was not any of the usual comedy, with people getting hurt and so.But at that time, The Big Lebowski being the only DVD in the House, i saw it again. Second time around it is a little funnier, but not much. Then i saw it a third time.... then it got to me.It is the funniest movie over made, period. The Characters are so funny: The Dude, Walther, The Nihilist... all are SO funny.And it gets funnier every time you watch it.The Dude lines are golden: "Year, well, that is like, just you opinion, man" and "Jackie Treehorn treats objects like women, man". And all of Walthers Jewish and Vietnam-thine is so funny every time."The Big Lebowski" is "Doctor Strangelove" of the 90ties.

Review title: A guy called the dude is forced from his daily routine to go on a hunt for a new rug.
Review_body: I loved this movie, loved it.Mind you, it doesn't seem many critics liked it that much. I can think of many reasons why, one is that I have bad taste, and the other is that they are so anal that they missed the entire point of the movie.I've heard the plot sucks, well, i've watched this several times, and I have yet to even notice the plot. The plot isn't the point, this movies point is the dude.Want me to sum up the plot?-A guy called the dude is forced from his daily routine to go on a hunt for a new rug.And thats about it, thats what drives the dude. When faced with the prospect of getting several thousand dollars, he remains concerned only with his rug. Getting serveral thousand dollars might force a change in his lifestyle after all, something he tries desperatly to get back throughout the course of this movie.This movie is looked at mostly from the point of view of the dude, as such, you see the world through his eyes. A bunch of events stopping him from getting a new rug. Jeff Bridges plays the part perfectly, out of place and annoyed by everything around him taking up his bowling time.I found the entire movie hilarious in a typical over done coen way, nothing anyone says is predictable, its very well acted, well paced, and well shot (of course).Just sit back and relax, don't look to hard, and enjoy the situations the dude ends up in because everyone around him refuses to adopt his life style. Whats the moral message of the movie? I dunno, who cares?

I honestly really did not enjoy this movie and actually think that it is highly overrated.I am thinking of watching it again because I must have missed something, there was absolutely no storyline, acting was average; all in all I could see nothing that separates this movie from the rest despite it being bad. OK, let me not be so hard, there were some elements in the movie that were not bad and the movie did display unique traits, I guess I was simply expecting more based on the very high IMDb rating and the other comments posted. I only hope that my comment will at least level the expectations of this film so that others who view it can be satisfied customers because I for one was not. In summary I am giving this movie a 4 out of 10. As said above I do intend to watch this flick again and hope that I can see what others have seen. Anyway this is just my two cents.//Mr. Blunt

this movie works on many different levels. It's a hilarious film in which you could watch it over and over thousands of times, and every time you would find something new to laugh about. This is officially my favorite movie of all times. The Coen Brothers are just magnificent. If you have not seen this movie yet, i would recommend that you rent it or buy it right away. It has a very interesting plot, and the character development is amazing. Most of the comedy in this film aren't just mindless potty humor, but instead deep funny and mature humor. I have shown many of my colleagues this film, and everyone has loved it. Rent this film right away I promise you won't be disappointed.

Review title: The movie that defines La-La Land
Review_body: Whenever I am far away from LA, longing for home, I pop this DVD into my player and enjoy one of the funniest, most enjoyably bizzare films I have ever seen. Along with Steve Martin's brilliant "LA Story" this stands as one of movies that captures the quirky, often times nonsensical aspects of living in Los Angeles (particularly if you live from Hollywood west towards Venice Beach). I really don't want to ruin the film by going into the plot, instead I will assure that it (A) captures the LA mystique and (B) is highly entertaining.

"The Big Lebowski" is easily a modern classic. It is so under appreciated it's sick. This movie rules! Every scene is funny and needs to seen again and again. This movie has everything;-Amazing characters achieved by actors at the top of their game.
-Great directing, including mind spinning dream sequences.
-Incredible music that meshes perfectly with the action.
-Sex-Drugs-Drinking-Violence-BowlingIf you like funny movies, I highly recommend this one. If you like detective movies, you will appreciate this film. If you like Chandler novels, you will LOVE this film.Do yourself a favor and go out and buy this modern classic. You won't believe how much you enjoy it.

This film still blows me away even after about 30 viewings! It is a blend of film noir/detective film(The BIG SLEEP, Maltese Falcon/All Through the Night)/comedy. The funny thing about it is you don't even realize that it is a detective film until you've seen it 2-3 times. I was loosely aware but it really sank in after the 3rd viewing! (i'm slow, i know) "The Dude"(Jeff Bridges)is in just about every scene, if not every scene. You get so caught up in watching him, his "laid backness", and his compatriots that you forget they are actually involved in trying to negotiate a ransom drop and recover a kidnap victim. "The Dude" is a reluctant hero along the lines of "Rick" from "Casablanca". Although not so self centered and altruistic as "Rick", it is evident from the start that "The Dude" would much rather be bowling and have a drink(a "White Russian", or as he called it, "a Caucasian") than have the responsibility of saving anyone's life.There may not be as many classic lines in this film as there are in the great films I compared it to above,but there are as many, if not more lines that get quoted by those who know and love this film.The last time I saw this(Big Lebowski) I kept asking myself what film does it remind me of the most? Then it hit me..."The Big Sleep". ;)

I understand that this movie is not for everybody, i had to also watch it two times before i started to like it. But when you are hooked, you really are hooked. I can't think of a funnier movie than this, the dialogues are simple but great!!! Only wish they would make a special edition DVD from this one, Joel and Ethan Coen really made their best film with this one. All the characters are unique, the dude is awesome played by Jeff Bridges. Simply my all time favorite movie***** out of *****

Love this movie! Seriously one of the best of all times! If you haven't seen this movie and have been debating it you must I mean must watch! The Cohen brothers are not only genius comedic writers but the way this movie is shot is brilliant as well! Point of view shots colors and slow mos of yeah! This is one of Jeff Daniels and John Goodman best rolls of all time! WATCH THIS MOVIE!!! Several times too because you end up catching a lot the second time around! The comedic timing from Steve Buschmi of my Gard! And John Tortoro as Jesus well need I mention that this is one of his best rolls as well! Everyone in the family (except for the under 14 age group because there is nudity) will enjoy this movie. It really did take me a couple times of watching it though to really get how brilliant it is!

Review title: I don't know why its so good, it just is.
Review_body: This is one of those films I watched because I thought I would look cool when I told my friends about it, but in fact I would not tell them about it because I wanted to keep it to myself.  It captures a mood and tells a very simple story along the way. I watched Fargo and thought it was OK, but did not think it was that good, but this was just "The Dude".

Review title: What was the actual point of the film?
Review_body: Unfunny and usless is the theme for this 'cult classic' There was far too many things going on I got lost so easily. There was no structure to the film and bored me so much I feel asleep twice. Even if I stayed awake I proberly still wouldn't get it.Even the fabulous John Goodman couldnt save this train wreak. Can I get me two hours back please?

Review title: awful movie, totally avoidable, non sense rating
Review_body: I wanted to spend my night laughing and so i skimmed through about 100 movies on IMDb, i came along some really funny movies, but i wanted to see a really good one so i kept looking until i came across this one. Excellent reviews, excellent rating !!!!! What more could i want. I rent the movie from the store, get cozy with my girl friend, and wait for the fun t begin.The movie starts with a guy being a target of a mistaken identity.....some bad things happen....to a certain extinct, little funny....and the plot continues and it goes on and on and on....and nothing at all is funny...by the mid of the movie, me and my girl friend are both bored and pi**ed off...... We couldn't take it anymore. I dint watch the rest of it.Moral: DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE. I dunno what kind of people gave a high rating to this crap.

Review title: it's a waste of time.right DUDE?
Review_body: I was quite interested in watching it.I thought it would be a 2 hours of laughter marathon.In the end i realized i didn't even laugh a single time. the whole story is hardly bears any meaning and there were some jokes i didn't get at all. One more important point is IMDb has been very poor in case of judging comedies.I just found "Monty Python and the holy grail" the same boring as Big Lebowski.So,don't be fooled by rating like me.My rating is 1(aweful)

Before I watched this film I was a high flying business man working in London. A mover and shaker, a big wig you know the type. I brought and destroyed people like you before lunch time just for kicks, but that all changed. On one of my rare moments off, I managed to slow down enough to watch this film. And let me say this I am a changed man. Instead of going to work and holding meetings with people all over the world, I just walk around in my pants all day drinking White Russians and touching myself. Oh and there's some bowling involved as well. Pay close attention to my story, for we all need to slow down. Instead of working have a drink, or go bowling. Or what ever you want I don't give a crap what you do!!!

Review title: Another gem from the Coen brothers
Review_body: I'm not sure if I can add to what's already written. This is just a great comedy. The interactions between Goodman and Buscemi make it worth the price of the rental. Fantastic characters as usual (if John Turturro's Jesus doesn't make you laugh, you're probably clinically dead).

I just bought The Big Lebowski on DVD and boy, had I forgotten how hilarious it was! I hadn't seen it since it was in the theatres 5 1/2 years ago, and I had forgotten how great some of those lines were. So many little details, like the 69 cent check for the half and half to commiting ones ashes to the "bosom of the Pacific". Every Coen brothers movie before and after this one has rocked, but this one still remains the best and easily the funniest. I know that the Coen's are fond of George Clooney right now, but it would great to bring back Jeff Bridges for another role as well as John Goodman. They made a great team. Everytime I watch this movie henceforth, I will be "adhering to a strict drug regimen to keep my mind limber."

If only I could count how many times this film has been able to cheer me up, I could probably only then begin to thank the Coen brothers for this gem of a film.  Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, and John Turturro fit perfectly into their characters while a stellar cast of supporting actors (Steve Buscemi, Julianne Moore, Sam Elliot) give quirky and hilarious performances.  The script is possibly the best coen script to date.  I know there was a backlash when this was first released with people looking for Fargo 2 but in my opinion this is the better film. Ten out of ten in my opinion, but for those who are offended by a few hundred curse words I suggest you steer clear of this one and rent...i don't know...goldmember or something. Anyway, see it or dont see it either way the dude will continue to abide.

I'll be honest : I adore this movie , however I find that it is not for everyone . If you are looking for a traditional comedy this is not it . The thing that this comedy has are colorful and creative flairs unlike any another . First off , the story is about a mid-aged hippie "the dude" who is mistaken to be a millionaire by two goons . They claim "the Dude" owes them money and subsequently urinate on his rug . Later on "The dude" goes to the millionaire and complains about the urinated rug . This is where the story unfolds to be a fusion of hippie culture , odd personalities and funny twists - resulting to be a creative perfection . I give the Coen brothers props for creating such well thought characters and having them creatively adjust to the entourage . As for the acting , I would say that Bridges and Goodman were perfect . This movie is a must for all you folks who love nontraditional comedies .

this is the worst movie i have ever seen. these kind of movies discourage the viewers from watching movies. there is no such base of the movie that i found meaningful. It bored a lot. There is no such comedy in this movie to be called a comedy genre movie. the Walter guy is really irritable. I don't understand why is his role included as he talks senseless all the time. You cannot even laugh on what he says, even nothing special in way of talking. The same is the case with the millionaire Lebowski. He too gets irritated easily and shouts a lot. Another irritable role. Its a great sacrifice of the normal state of mind to watch this stuff. You just get up out of your mind. Standing ovation to me for watching the whole length.

Sometimes the film is so good you have to say something. Sometimes the film is so bad you have to say something. Unfortunately it is the latter in this case. I finally started to watch The Big Lebowski. Great reviews everywhere. Have to watch it. It is one of Coen brothers movies. It is rated almost five stars in Amazon. It is rated 8.2 on IMDb. It has to be good, right?Not quite. I couldn't finish it - I had to stop watching it.In the beginning you see a resemblance in the style of this movie and a lot of Quentin Tarantino's movies. I don't know if Coen brothers are borrowing from Quentin Tarantino, or if it's the other way around, but there seems to be plenty of resemblance to this film and Tarantino's films in general.The best Coen brothers movie that they made was Fargo, and maybe it was so good because it was based on a true story. But for this, The Big Lebowski, it reeked of stupidity...but without comedy. It seemed to border on fantasy and improbability.

Before I give my review I am not the best at holding concentration. This film just baffled me despite great actors with great performances. For me it was very hard to follow and my missus even agreed and she has a great attention span. This film is so highly rated so I'm more inclined to say it's a problem with me and deffo not them. Watch it and make your own mind up. Goodman and bridges are brilliant as usual though.

Review title: The best hour and 45 minutes of your life!!!!
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is one of the most talked about comedies ever created. When I first saw it I hated it. Then a year later I ended up re-watching it, and liking it. Then loving it. Then I was hooked.The movie opens up with some old random dude telling us a story. He explained all about his fascination with the Dude. Then we see how the story all begins. In the middle we meet a lot of bizarre characters such as the laughing man, the fat boring kid, the nazi/analysts, and the bald guy in the little buggy.By the end of the movie you will probably dislike or be confused with the film but by the 4th time around, you wont ever understand how you could ever dislike it!

"Big Lewbowski" is one of the very few comedies that still cracks me up every single time I watch it.For what some might dub as a "stoner comedy," there's quite a lot going on this movie, and it's damn near impossible to catch everything on the first viewing. I wont get into the plot details, since I think it's best to watch it for the first time without knowing anything about it. Then watch it again a couple weeks later. I'll bet you laugh more the second time you see it. Office Space was the only other comedy that had this affect on me. Oh and one other thing. DO NOT WATCH THE EDITED VERSION ON TV! This movie is rated R for a reason, and if you watch the edited version you are missing half the movie.

I would say that "Big Lebowski" has to be one of the funniest movies I've ever seen, and I have seen a LOT. There is kind of a 'circle of life' thing...in the world of L.A. slackers, everything works out, man, don't worry. Donnie dies, little Lebowski is born. Thus it continues. But you don't watch this for the message. It's got an excuse for a plot, at least: Big Lebowski's wife owes money to crooks and is kidnapped. 'The Dude' Lebowski is mistaken for the millionaire by the same name and his carpet is pi$$ed upon in a misunderstanding. Seeking compensation for the rug (which really tied the room together) he ends up commissioned to deal with the crooks. Introduce a trio of Nihilists (with marmot), a half-crazed feminist painter (Julianne Moore), a porno film industry and a gay pedophile who's extremely competitive about bowling (John Turturro) and you've got it...the ultimate stoned slacker comedy. Jeff Bridges is far out as The Dude, and hilariously understated, while John Goodman is his psychotically violent 'Nam vet best friend, who carries a piece to a bowling alley, and John Turturro is forever etched into my memory as Jesus Quintana (spoken to Walter: "You got a date for Wednesday, baby! Whoo!" Walter: "...He's cracking.") Steve Buscemi was adorably pathetic as Donnie, the third wheel. One of the best quotes: Donnie: Are these the Nazis, Walter? Walter: No, Donnie, these men are Nihilists. There's nothing to be afraid of. It was very memorable, with excellent characters which is basically all that made it worth watching...the Coen's signature style doesn't come through here like it does in Fargo, and it's not overly artistic (well...in parts maybe) but it's so funny! Excellent, excellent. Especially The Dude's stoned dreams (which feature Saddam Hussein renting out bowling shoes).

A typical Coen movie - plot intertwined with sub-plot intertwined with another sub-plot intertwined with seemingly genuine and lovable characters (as well as 'love-to-hate' characters). What's not to love about the Dude? I aspire to be more like him everyday, and even if that's the only thing you take away from this film, it would be well worth it. This guy introduced me to 'White Russian' ('Caucasian') cocktails - vodka, Kahlua and cream. Try to keep up with the plot, learn to love Donnie but overall, enjoy the laid back humour and classic 'one liners' that you'll be repeating over and over...and over..and over again!

Review title: Deeply deadening and very jejune = So damn Humorless.
Review_body: If a movie has a good rating in IMDb, I usually purchase a Blu- Ray to support good movie makers. That's why I paid more than 10 euro to watch it at home.I was never disappointed by IMDb Ratings before thus the money I have paid to watch other high rated movies was worth it. However, this was anything but that, I waited and waited for this movie to become funny and interesting but I got nothing but totally dull moments with no humor at all.I fell asleep after a hour or so and let me tell you that I have never ever slept so soundly while watching a movie. I don't know what happened after a hour and I'm not at all interested to know. I didn't even chuckle the entire time I was awake but finally the next day I was laughing at myself for spending money on this prosaic work and this was the only laugh I got from it. Only watch this movie if you have insomnia. This movie could very well be the next step in treating sleep disorders. Bottom line: The most overrated movie in history - waste of time and money - unimaginably dull, slow, humorless, uninteresting ....+ all the synonyms of BORING in the thesaurus.

The Big Lebowski is, without a single doubt, one of the funniest movies of all-time. It's that kind of movie where you just can't stop laughing at it's glorious achievements at humor. I literally hurt myself with laughter multiple times during this movie.The great thing about The Big Lebowski, other than it's amazing humor, is how good of a movie it actually is. Along with the laughter, you get an awesome movie with a fun story.Comedies do not get much better than this. The Big Lebowski stands among the top not just in comedies, but in general good movies. It's highly recommended to anyone searching for a new favorite movie.

Review title: F*** it dude, let's go bowling
Review_body: This film is most definitely one of the best by the Coen Brothers. Granted Fargo and Oh Brother are amazing, along with the rest of theirs, but considering that the age group right now for 15-28 year old males are right at home with this film. So quotable from anything Walter(Goodman) says to the liberal tomfoolery of "The Dude"(Bridges), and they bowl all the time. this film is more than amazing.The "Dude" as he likes to call himself is misconstrued as a rich Lebowski in town under the same name of Jeff Lebowski, and his rug is adulterated by the "Chinaman". Seeking recompense for his rug, for which he claims "ties the room together" he approaches the Lebowski the henchmen were actually looking for. After meeting the real Lebowki, who is an old rich conservative with a young attractive wife(Tara Reid), he hires the Dude to help pay the ransom on his young wife Bunny.The plot turns into a twister of events leading The Dude on an adventure aided by his partner in crime Walter. He meets many odd, quirky characters such as Muade Lebowski, played by Julianne Moore, who delves in an Idiosyncratic sexual docket. I suggest everyone see this film, not only the frat guy generation will love it, but anyone who can laugh at a joke and understand making fun of both liberals and conservatives, will love this film through and through. 9 outta 10.

One of the best comedies I've ever seen in my entire life and definitely one of my favorite films ever. It figures... we are talking about two writers that produce gold every time their pens touch paper and about a truly incredible cast! The story is absurd and brilliant, but the real strong point of this movie are the characters: The Dude (Jeff Bridges), Walter (John Goodman), Donny (Steve Buscemi), Maude (Julian Moore) and of course Jesus (John Torturo), five of the many in this film, really rare types of persons that produce some masterpiece acting from all actors, stars or not... The movie is full of out of the normal situations that watching them will make you laugh your heart out and amazingly intelligent lines!Definitely a very special film, you're going to laugh really really hard and you'll never forget it...
I don't know what I just watched, but I had fun watching it.

The Coen Brothers created cult followings worldwide when they released this 1998 film noir comedic classic. This movie features stellar performances from both Jeff Bridges and John Goodman as the laid back "The Dude" Lebowski and the angry Vietnam veteran Walter who go on a quest to seek compensation for The Dude's urinated stained rug and get caught up in a unusual mystery. In addition to a hilarious script, it features a eclectic soundtrack of the likes of Bob Dylan, Captain Beefheart and Creedence Clearwater Revival which fits the mood of the movie. After seeing this movie, I would now put this film amongst my favorites and recommended that everybody see it. The dude abides....

What makes this an outstanding comedy?!? The fact that you laugh louder the 4th time, the 5th time you watch it. It's not only a comedy of punch lines (when you enjoy it the 1st time, then the 2nd time it's not that funny, cause you already know the catch). It's the classical style of the movie's atmosphere that sets the adorable mood.What makes it a classic?!? The 11th time, the 12th time you watch it, you don't get bored. Perhaps you won't laugh out loud like you previously did, but it still gets you in that mood.In addition, this comedy is sprinkled with some serious social matters. Read between the lines, watch between the scenes...!

Really liked this movie, I heard from a friend that this was his favorite movie so I thought I'd give it a chance. It's a movie that I would watch multiple times because apart from the great plot it was also very funny and the music was well chosen. Jeff Bridges makes you believe that he really is "The Dude", and you start too sympathize with him even though he is a lazy unemployed man. When the film started with a voice-over of an old man i thought "oh this is gonna be so long and boring", but it wasn't until 5 minutes later that I totally changed my mind, and I was sucked into the story-line . I gave this film eight stars and I would definitely recommend it.

Review title: What was funny in this movie?
Review_body: I am reading comments like the Greatest comedy movie of all times. What was funny in this movie?

I caught this film a few years after it came out, with no real expectation, and thought it was OK. However, I had a nagging feeling that there was more to it than I first realised. So I watched it again, and laughed or smiled the whole way through! The Characters play off each other so well; Walter who is actually never really wrong, Donnie who never quite manages to get involved, and the Dude, well, he just wants his rug back.As I am writing this I feel a sense of pride that I re-watched this film as quick as I did. I have since found other "Lebowski" enthusiasts who agree that it was on the 2nd watch that the film really comes together.I could quote the film silly, but that would spoil it, so just watch the film. If you like the Coen's or just quirky humorous films, then this is for you...

Review title: Too good to be true, dude!
Review_body: Dude... WOW. First of all; Do you love John Goodman as much as I do? If you are a fan of Mr. Goodman, this is a movie you HAVE to watch. But of course, his role is not everything that's good with this movie, but maybe the BEST part. After watching this movie you will think; I WANT TO WATCH IT AGAIN. But after realizing how amazing Goodman is, it will be changed to: I WANT TO WATCH IT AGAIN, RIGHT NOW. I watched it because I love Joel and Ethan Coen, plus I had watched one of the car scenes hundreds of times on YouTube. So it checked it out.. Well; wow, this movie chocked me.
