Goosebumps, tears of joy and laughter is what Joel and Ethan brings up in this comedy. It is a comedy that will bite your arm and never let go. It is pure awesomeness and happiness. At some point you will find this movie a bit "bad use of sci-fi effects", to someone a bit pointless and for someone maybe a bit boring, but who cares about this when you have the Coen brothers, a perfect written screenplay and outstanding actors cooked together? I recommend this movie with all of my heart. It is unique!

Review title: How is This Movie Barely in the Top#250???? How???!!!!
Review_body: Seriously, Seeing 'Lebowski' so near the bottom of the Top 250 is pretty damn unsettling to say the least. This is certainly beyond the shadow of a doubt one of the funniest movies ever made, and I'm really holding back when I say that. And seeing this ignoble rating certainly begs the unpleasant question, 'Could this film actually ever fall off of what should be a coveted 250 list?' The sheer vastness of this error in taste makes me question seriously the movie viewing competence of those here, and I'm not even elitist! Can someone help me out here?? Please explain!!!! Thanks in advance. -JB

I had a professor in college that used to always tell us, "the world needs more bowling leagues." It was a strange thing to say, I thought, in an Intro to American Politics class. This professor gave us the example of when he was in graduate school he and his wife joined a bowling league in their town. He said that it was a great way to meet new people whom you may have never otherwise thought of spending time with. He said that our society needed to relearn those social skills. After every viewing of "The Big Lebowski" I think back to this professor's recommendation to join a bowling league."The Big Lebowski" was always one of those films that was recommended to me to be included on my list of movies that I should see before I die. While I had already seen a fair number of Coen Brothers films, I was still a little hesitant to watch this one. I finally gave it a chance one rainy afternoon. I have to admit, the first time I watched it I thought to myself, "what did I just watch?" I laughed a lot, yes, but I couldn't wrap my head around it. As with many films I watch, I let it simmer in my brain for a while. A few months later I gave the movie a second chance. This time, at the end of the movie, I realized that I had just seen a piece of art. Every subsequent viewing I find that I like it more and more. In my opinion, it is the best performance by Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, and Steve Buscemi of their entire careers. While I don't usually describe it as my all-time favorite movie, I have recently been coming back to this movie when in conversations with friends about truly great movies. I tell people to have patience with it. Don't expect to be satisfied with the ending...right away, at least. "The Big Lebowski" has aged extremely well, too. I feel it is even better now than when it was first released. In our era of instant gratification and social media, we need a movie like this. We need to join more bowling leagues.

Review title: One of the greatest films of the '90s
Review_body: It is difficult to define one genre for this masterpiece:Coen Brothers combine comedy with various elements of the noir movies, such as the abundance of characters linked to each other through secret ties that reveal the rottenness behind everyone.Our protagonist is not the usual policeman or private investigator damned and alcoholic, but a complete idler,Jeffrey Lebowski(interpreted by Jeff Bridges) who will be meddled in a case of alleged kidnapping. The film is set in Los Angeles in the early 1990s, with characters well-outlined and marked by a story behind, many of which are just victims of events that live or are forced to live.The Jeffrey Lebowski characterization is gorgeous: a middle-aged lover of bowling and white Russian (this movie will make you want to drink one immediately!),in which there is a great influence of Taoist philosophy.Jeffrey abides all the events that come to him, staying calm and never getting angry.Just like a Taoist sage, he does practically nothing to change his situation. He never takes position in doing something, he always finds himself victim of the events.The protagonist is joined by Walter (played by John Goodman), representing Jeffrey's complete opposite: this character is in fact presumptuous and violent; he is angry at all (the scene where he threatens to shoot an acquaintance only because he broke a rule of Bowling is awesome) and takes the situation in hand, turning it completely.The contrast between the two is functional: like the yin and the yang, the two friends complement each other creating a balance between disorder and order, activity and passivity.Photography and direction are sublime, the only opening scene is worth more than whole films. The Coen brothers manage to focus the attention of the spectator on objects and minutia, even with mute shots and without giving much explanation. Salient points are then highlighted by the scenes in which the protagonist is out of his own (as when it is hit in the head) in which his subconscious frees up and transforms Jeffrey's desires and thoughts into true images. In the visions are actually present the bowling, carpet and daughter of the homonym Mr Lebowski dressed as a Valkyrie (surely to mark the nationality of the nihilists with whom she had to do).The soundtrack is very good for the film, so it is connected to Lebowski as much as his dressing gown and cocktails.End up finally recommending this movie to anyone: that you love the investigative films or the comedies you can not do without this movie! You can see it with your family in cheerfulness and tranquility, or have a thorough insight into the Freudian nature of visions and the well-delineated philosophy of the characters and still enjoy this masterpiece, which would definitely be seen at least once in life.

Review title: Quite simply the best movie ever made...
Review_body: Perfect in every way. Acting, script, direction, cinematography, soundtrack....an absolute joy.

Review title: scam reviews, don't waste your time
Review_body: Just do a language analysis of the reviews, obiously the Coen brothers paid fake reviewers to talk up their crap movie. Save your self the pain. Do not watch this movie.

This, in my opinion, is quite possibly one of the best films of all time. With an all star cast including Steve Buscemi, Jeff Bridges, and Jon Goodman. These men were born to play these roles! They go on and on about almost anything. Very strong and well thought out characters. Turturro is another favorite of mine, portraying the character Jesus in this story. The movie flows well, and in the end it concludes that even the biggest losers in the world can make a difference. Having watched this movie over 500 times now I could go on about it for days, but this is a must see for anyone! It is my life dream to meet the dude in person, he is an actual person according to the Coens. Only the Coen brothers could make a two hour work of art on such a random series of events! amazing, 10!!!

Review title: very odd movie, few like it ever written
Review_body: This movie didn't interest me much the first time I watched, but I eventually purchased the movie on DVD. You have to really dissect this movie to understand how good it is.The characters seem random at first, but as you watch it a few times the way in which the dialogue flows becomes very funny. Credit to the writers, because the dialogue is really what makes this movie. Not much of a plot, no real ending, a silly premise - throw in a kidnapping, and that's the movie.If you're a type A personality, you might not like this movie much, but for the type B's, and further on down the alphabet, (the further the better) Great Movie!

A cult movie? Really? I guess it's like marmite. You hate it or love. Nothing in between. Personally for me I was recommended by some stoic saying this movie is about stoicism. Didn't get any of that. So watch it at your own peril I'd say. I'm fairly disappointed I've gotta admit.

This film is, to me, a masterpiece. The dude exemplifies what humans are lacking generally. I totally get that there are many people that don't get it, of course they don't... I assume they were hoping for a slapstick generic comedy. This has style and finesse, that is unique and makes me happy. If you do get it, you can watch it over and over, at least once a year for a top up. ... Absolutely brilliant!
All folks is very excited about this movie. In asked myself if i maybe didn't get the point. For me it's just an average light comedy. Nothing special.

I'm one of those sick people who actually didn't like Fargo all that much. The characters were boring, the plot was uninspired, and the sense of humor was irritating and pretentious (I guess I'm the only one that doesn't think boring dialogue about ice and snow between cops at a murder scene is laugh-out-loud hilarious).  The Big Lebowski, however, is ten times the movie Fargo is.The characters are just great.  Even minor characters get special quirks that make them far more interesting than the major characters in most recent movies.  And the protagonist, Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski (Jeff Bridges), is the kind of guy who wanders down to the supermarket in his bathrobe at night to write a 69 cent check for a carton of milk.  I'm tired of boring, ridiculously one-dimensional main characters who get close-ups every other second while using lines like, "I'm not going back without my men!"  The Dude is an unlikely hero if there ever was one, and that is why he is a most refreshing and memorable one.  There's The Dude's best friend Walter (John Goodman), a well-read and impulsive Vietnam vet; Jesus, the purple -clad sex offender/bowler; Maude Lebowski(Juliane Moore), the feminist artist who speaks of "coitus"; and a crazed group of ideologically-confused nihilists, among so many other great characters.  The dialogue is priceless.The plot is very unique and ridiculous, but it fits the movie absolutely perfectly.  The Dude and Walter get involved in a shady world of kidnapping , embezzlement, porn, reactionary cops, and just about everything else, when all the Dude ever wanted was compensation for a rug of his that had been urinated on by confused debt collectors who were looking for a different man also named Jeff Lebowski. There are so many great little touches in this movie.  The Dude's dream /blackout sequences are hilarious (complete with Saddam Hussein handing out bowling shoes and bowling combined with porn imagery).  The script is very clever  and the movie as a whole is an incredible experience.  The best part of The Big Lebowski is how strangely wonderful the whole thing is; don 't expect most moronic movie critics to understand it.  In a perfect world, The Big Lebowski would be in the AFI's Top 100 instead of Fargo.  It's the type of movie you never want to end.

This film is completely excellent.  In addition to the wonderful acting and scenes mentioned by everyone else, how about:  the landlord?  the landlord's pathetic interpretive dance?  and Walter (Goodman) showing up at the landlord's pathetic interpretive dance wearing a COAT and TIE because, by God, that's the proper thing to do - when you go to a cultural event you dress for the occasion, AM I RIGHT?And don't forget the cameo appearance by the greatest hamburger in the world:  In and Out!

My new all-time fave flick.  A meandering plot - if you can call it  plot (a bit like being stoned and forgetting what you were going to say next - then just changing the subject completely)- but it doesn't matter!  All the characters are perfect - even though we don't see much of Turturro and Buscemi.  Jeff Bridges is superb - and looking VERY good.  The Dialogue and scenes make it a cult classic - and it didn't even make it to my local cinema!

What a product of modern lack of morals.  I heard this movie was funny, and it had an interesting plot.  Boy was I disappointed.  I'm not one to wince at a bit of vulgar language, but this movie had nothing but sexual references, horrible vituperation (you'd think movie writers could build up their vocabulary a bit), and on top of that progressed so slowly I think watching paint dry could have been more exciting.  I feel sorry for anyone who was entertained by this Hollywood slop.  I didn't even make it to the end of the movie, what a waste of $4.50.

Now, I know people have complained about this film stating it was stupid and that it didn't make any sense...well, I'll speak for myself, I loved it! The Coen Bros. are the best filmakers of our time and this was no exception. Jeff Bridges was superb as the "Dude" and surprised me with his transformation into a slacker. John Goodman, Steve Buscemi and John Turturro(all Coen vets) put in memorable roles and made the film that much better! Watch for Jon Polito as the private detective following the "Dude", he was also in Miller's Crossing and Barton Fink.A word of advice, if you loved Fargo, do not expect a sequel, you'll be very disappointed. Expect the unexpected and enjoy it for what it is, a very funny comedy.
I think this movie is as funny as "Raising Arizona" and to me it is much more relevant to the average person than "Fargo" was. I recommend this movie to all those who don't listen to the hype.

Review title: Jelly shoes can be worn by just one man, the dude.
Review_body: I hadn't heard much about this film, but it was recommended to me highly, so I rented it out from the video shop and couldn't bring myself to take it back the next day, or the day after that for that matter, amounting to a couple of days worth of fines, but what the hey, it was worth it. From the very beginning when the China man pees on his rug, I knew I was in for a cracker, and I was right. The characters are excellent, the lines are sharp and funny, but best of all as the narrator claimed, it is a really cool story.This is my film of the year, yes I know it was released last year and I know its only february, but it's that good, watch it now, before I send the China man 'round to pee on your rug!

How cool is this movie !!!! Dude........ it's way cool. Caught this movie in London the first time, then saw it in New York the second time, now its on cable in OZ !!!!! A great cast with a good story and brilliant direction.

Review title: One of the best movies ever made!!
Review_body: Only from the makers of Fargo could a movie such as this be made. A jewel of a film full of great performances, and one of the wackiest, wildest plots ever written. A great ride, funny, and (believe it or not)extremely intelligent. John Goodman at his best as the Vietnam Vet with a screw loose!! Jeff Bridges makes post-60s hippy life look great too!

When I first sat down to watch The Big Lebowski, I looked around and thought, hey where am I. Who is that strange man on the floor? Then I turned on the movie. As you can tell I enjoyed the movie, but had trouble seeing it considering I was recently maced.The Dude (Bridges), so he is called by his friends, is an obvious sociopath. He has little to no regard for any life especially his own. The Dude should come hang out with me and my friends so we can share some white russians.Walter (Goodman) is the best foil character for the Dude.The best part of the film was played by Buscemi. He played Donnie. Donnie will be sorely missed.

Review title: One of my favorites ...all time classic to be
Review_body: Well , when i first saw it I missed many parts or little details which made this masterpiece so much funnier , the characters introduced are so unique and original I was really impressed.. Maybe because this was my first Coen/Coen movie it hit me hard.Dude Lebowski is so lazy that at certain points he can't even think what to say so he copies what George Bush says ,or writes a check for less than a dollar..?This movie in a way makes fun of Jews , Italians , Poles , Germans ,Swedes ,Greeks , Mexicans but not in a vulgar way .I really loved the attitude 'the dude ' had when someone broke into his house smashing the door while he was smoking pot in his bathtub ...' hey this is a private apartment ..' Or the fact that he drank everyday about at least 3 white russians.Then in comes Sobczak , the dude's buddy and bowl mate .This guy is absolutely played fabulously by John Goodman . He is so fixated about rules and these  'rules' have been fought for by himself and so many other ' good guys ..in Nam ' . This fixation is so strong that at a certain point he points a gun at a bowling contestant because he went ' over the line ' but claimed otherwise .Or the fact that he argues with ' autobahn ' nihilists that ' these are not the rules  ! ...without a hostage there is no ransom '.Anyway simply the idea of introducing a character like Sobczak who is a pole who was in Vietnam , lives in the states and pretends he's Jewish (because his ex-wife was ) but really is a catholic  is absolutely hilarious to me..All the characters in this movie are worth mentioning but space runs out !I'd conclude that this movie is a rare type of low budget , non-Hollywood-mega-project movie that to me is at a higher level than many action-packed , super-fx ,multimillionaire movies that are coming out these days . I'll certainly look out for more Coen movies...

Review title: The Human Races finest artistic achievement
Review_body: Sha la la   la la la  la la Sha la la   la la la  la la Sha la la   la la la  la la  lalala la la   la laThe man in me will do nearly any task But as for compensation there is a little he would askFantastic!  My favorite movie for sure.  Please everyone go rent it - but, just a fair warning, it took me maybe 2-3 or more times through it to really appreciate all the language and detail that make it so artistic and hilarious.I'm talking about drawing a line in the sand here dude.. ACROSS THIS LINE - YOU DO NOT Also dude...

Review title: It's one of a handful of comedies that gets funnier each time.
Review_body: It's one of the few comedies that gets funnier each time you watch it. I just saw it again a few nights ago and laughed out loud at least a dozen times. It has so many qualities that you look for in being able to watch a movie more than once (memorable lines- "Hey man there's a beverage involved here!" great characters- when will I see a movie about Jesus the bowling freak and an interesting plot- too involved to mention)The performances by Jeff Bridges and John Goodman are just incredible, I could remember after I saw it the first time I wanted to become the Dude. Steve Buscemi is also great in a more relaxed comedic role opposed to his normal freaky type characters. Very original and funny.

This is one hell of a film.  I first saw it in the theatre as a preview (my teacher at the time often gave us free passes!!) before I had heard any bad press about it.  I was so confused the first time, and wondering what was this about, that it made me want to see it again.  That is when I know that I am going to like a movie, when i want to see it again.  The main character, The Dude (Or El dudarino if you are not into the whole brevity thing) is quite simply the laziest person in the world.  The Dude, whose life revolves around drinking White Russians (Which I now drink mostly because of the movie, and mostly cause I like um!) and smoking grass while driving and listening to some Creedence, is "taking it easy for all us sinners".  The plot revolves around him, and how his soiled rug gets him into a fandangle that no one could expect.  The movie does so much with so little, kind of in a Seinfeld "show about nothing" type of deal.  But what makes this movie a 10 is the superb acting!!  What a cast, Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, Jullianne Moore, and of course the gorgeous Tara Reid.  This movie has so many intense conversations, that you could practically watch it with just the sound on, and still laugh your ass off. Please, ignore what anyone says, and watch this film, and then watch it again, cause it gets funnier every time!

This might not be the best movie you have ever seen. The first time you see it, you probably will not love it, but after you see it a couple of times and start thinking back on it, it becomes a favorite. The characters really jump out at you, even the non-main ones.

I couldn't follow any of the plot because all it seemed to have in it are these two men swearing.  I don't mind the swearing when it serves a purpose, but this movie was ridiculous.  It seemed to me that every other word was the "F" word.  If you can get past the language, you might be able to tell if there is a story to it.

Review title: An assault to the ears, eyes, and mind
Review_body: I came to this movie a fan of the Coen Brothers, Jeff Bridges, and nearly all of the cast members of this film. I came to this movie expecting smart satire and cinematic invention. The first 30 minutes of this film offended me on every level possible!  It is grotesque and perverse and sophomoric. I can't remember hating a film more. I never had the stomach to finish this disaster of a film, which is ugly to the eyes and the soul.   Do yourself a favor and watch FARGO, or the equally incomparable O' BROTHER WHERE ART THOU.

Review title: This is intelligent comedy at its best.
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is one of those rare movies that is still funny after watching it a dozen times.  It is so hard to make good comedy that is even funny the first time through, but the quirkiness of the characters in this film and the brilliant dialogue create a world and story with depth and style.  The writing has a strength to it, reminiscent of The Princess Bride (albeit with slightly more profanity) and Pulp Fiction.

Review title: Ksam44's 10 rating of The Big Lebowski
Review_body: A hilarious movie!! A treat for fans of the Coen Brothers. Jeff Bridges and John Goodman are great especially when they are interacting in scenes together. Just one small complaint: Steve Buscemi's role is to small, other then that this film gets a 10 in my book!

Review title: In the parlance of our times...
Review_body: I haven't stopped watching this movie since I first saw it about 2 months ago. I guess by reading some of the other user comments that this is the kind of movie that you either love or hate - and I love it!The story is fantastic. The running theme isn't particularly complex but it doesn't need to be. It puts the incredibly laid-back Dude in a series of outrageous situations that no stoner should ever be exposed to! I guess the funniest thing about the movie is that I know a guy who could be evenly compared with the dude and I suppose I'm not the only one - haven't most of us known (or been) a lazy stoner at some point? The story is perpetually fuelled with a line of eccentric characters, all quite different from the dude in personality and lifestyle. The Dude's interactions with them in his quest to obtain a replacement rug are hilarious (especially with the Malibu Chief of Police!!).Julianne Moore is fantastic as the artist/feminist millionaire. The line she delivers to Dude while Bunny's porn film is running is a classic: "The story is ludicrous" she says with disdain, viewing the porn flick with her critical eye (post-irony at its best!).I did think that the inclusion of Sam Elliot was a needless one. Essentially the story didn't require the 'insight' of a narrative and although I appreciate the comic value of his inclusion, perhaps he might have been better utilised on another project?Essentially, and I think this is the case with more than one of the Coen Brother's films, is that the dialogue is excellent - it is nearly always the way the lines are delivered that makes the scenes so funny, not the actual lines themselves. This is true for many different characters in this movie, from the Big Lebowski himself to the Chief of Malibu Police (who's scene with the Dude is comedy genius).Anyway, I can't knock it - I love the movie, "His Dudeness" is one of the funniest/best characters I have ever seen and I cannot recommend this movie enough...particularly if you're a middle aged, jobless stoner...I'm not, by the way...middle aged that is!

Could you imagine anyone taking care to check the "contains spoilers" box before submitting a comment on this movie. The joys of this movie have so little to do with plot revelations that checking that box would be superfluous even if the comment did reveal spoilers. This is the Cohen brothers best movie. I will make a bold prediction: In twenty years, Fargo will have receded into the shadows of forgotten but once praised films, while The Big Lebowski will still be providing its own unique version of wit and humour to film lovers who appreciate the kind of comedy that comes out of funny characters and organic natural feeling dialogue.

Review title: It is a crime this did not receive an Academy Award
Review_body: I can say without a doubt that this is the Coen Brothers best film. Though they have made many other great movies and are two of my most favorite directors/writers in Hollywood now, they absolutely shine with The Big Lebowski. The funniest thing about this movie is how all of the peculiar and hilarious characters and situations come together so gracefully. Where Raising Arizona and Barton Fink tried fairly successfully at accomplishing this feat, the Big Lebowski does this flawlessly: The Dude's crazy dream sequences, Walter's paranoid, infuriated ramblings about history and American policy, the ridiculous dialogue between the Dude, Walter, and Donnie, Maude's elitist LA interactions with the Dude, the aggressive German kidnappers, and the narration of the strange Cowboy, played masterfully by Sam Elliot all merge seamlessly to form a comedic masterpiece that gets better on repeated viewings. Like the hugely successful show Seinfeld, the main characters, Walter and the Dude, never seem to accomplish anything of any value, but the combination of Walter's incompetent aggression and the Dude's incredible misfortune produces a story as complex as it is funny. At the end of this movie, you may be asking yourself what you just saw and what good came from all the foul language and unusual dialogue between Walter, the Dude, and the other characters in the movie. The best thing is to just sit back and laugh uncontrollably at the strange situations the characters find themselves in, along with the accompanying dialgue. Every time I watch this movie, and it has been quite a lot, I pick up new quotes and find new things to laugh at. As mentioned in the summary, the fact that out of all the Coen Brothers films, the only two to win Academy awards was Fargo and O Brother Where Art Thou is a travesty and does a disservice to the inherent comedic genius that this movie displays. Although I hate saying never, I don't think a movie of this comedic magnitude will come out again.

This film is absolutely fantastic.  It stands up to many re-watchings, this is mainly due to the quality of the dialogue.  The whole film is just so quotable and they become part of everyday speech.  All the performances are amazing especially the three friends and John Turturro is brillant as Jesus

Review title: Hilarious one-liners, and an enveloping plot.
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is, contrary to critical opinion, the best of the Coen Brothers' movies. It seems that every line has been crafted with the keenest of eyes for hilarity. Every word out of almost every character's mouth is funny. Bridges is genius as the slacker-bum, John Goodman is extremely entertaining as the put-upon, aggressive Vietnam vet. You'll be quoting Jesus Quintana (John Turturro) for weeks after the movie.If you like intelligent humor, a plot that will keep you guessing, and movies you'll be sorting out for weeks after viewing, you'll LOVE The Big Lebowski!

This is the greatest film ever made. Or, depending on who you are, the worst. As other reviews have noted, you will either get this film and love it, or you will probably hate it. Either way is fine because that's just like your opinion man. In my opinion, this movie stands up to repeated viewings with ease. It seems like there is always a new nugget with each view. The layers in this film are staggering, and I don't think it's hyperbole to say this is the greatest film ever made. If you have seen this film once, and you hated it, I encourage you to watch it two more times. I was hooked from the opening credits, but my wife did not like it. But, she likes me, so she did not balk when I wanted to continue my habit of repeated viewings. After about the third time, she was quoting lines and pointing out some of the motif's. Now, she hardly ever refuses me when I want to put it on, even though she does usually tell me that I'm not wrong, I'm just an ***hole.

This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen. Smart, clever, and very well acted. Very refreshing. Thank God for Joel and Ethan Coen. Jeff Bridges is absolutely hilarious as the Dude, and John Goodman... what can I say? Priceless. Philip Seymour Hoffman made me laugh so hard, and I don't think he was supposed to. Highly recommended.

Review title: A different comedy. MUST BE SEEN.
Review_body: I love this film ! I own the video and have seen it 4 times. A different comedy. I recommend it to everybody who hasn´t seen it. The characters play excelent. Especially John Goodman. As said before: A must see !

Is it supposed i have to laugh with the most ridiculous and stupid characters i've ever seen? I hope not. I'd say it's the most stupid movie i've ever seen. There is no hidden humor, or smart comedy. Everything goes around the big dude. Or I'd say, the big asshole! The movie itself is a comedy, it is a parody of a comedy. I have no clue why people loved this movie so much. I start seeing the movie because of that and I've to say it was a complete disappoint. How someone can laugh with such a bad movie? No clue, if someone can explain me that I'd really appreciate it. The big fraud, the big piece pf crap, the big plot without any story... all of them would be really nice names for this movie. Make yourself a favor and don't miss your time seeing this movie.

Dead funny, hilarious, intelligent and absolutely original. The acting (especially John Goodman) is first rate and the Coen brothers seem to have the time of their life. No deeper thoughts here, just entertainment for a demanding audience.

Review title: Highly rewatchble sharp and witty movie , one of the best in comedic genre
Review_body: Review - the big lebowski is an movie with simple story plot, cleverly written by coen brothers . this movie is so unique In the way of making and it has no format or morale its been filled up with various concepts, and describing it is really hard. It will leave you two options , whether you will like it or you will hate it. The characterzation are so brilliantly made by coen brothers and executed with perfect casting. Jeff bridges as "the dude" -jeff lebowski had completely nailed his role. And john Goodman as Walter done his supporting role wonderfully and its worthy of notice. Its an comedy element filled with brutally action package. The big lebowski is an movie with sharp witty story line and more you re-watch this film more fun you would get for sure. And of the best in comedic genre.

Review title: He could be my best friend.
Review_body: He could be my best friend. Jeff Bridges is so good in this film which makes it ridiculous. He's the dude. End of story. Bowling, carpet, milk, White Russian... Those are things have stayed all these years. It's brilliant.

Review title: For time killing The Big Lebowski is the one of the best movies
Review_body: This movie is certainly original . Yes that is the perfect word to describe that movie. I watched 3 times , never love it but I didn't get bored during the movie at all . I don't know if I may watch this movie again or not. But it is certainly an original movie. While watching this movie your face is in the same shape , never laugh hard, don't get upset or anything. Your face will be in the same form at the beginning of the movie and when it ends. If you have time and don't know what to watch it is a good choice. But it won't be your favorite movie ever ...After that movie I realized that laziness is maybe a very smart choice to really enjoying the life.

Review title: The rug really tied the room
Review_body:
One of my most favorite movie!
So many hilarious moments!
If you watch this film in russian, I recommend you choose a goblin's translate.

Review title: Exceptional... am I wrong... AM I WRONG!
Review_body: If you're lucky enough to have never seen this film before, you're in for a treat. It's one of the greatest pieces of cinema, a true classic. The Coen brothers are legends and this is one of their best. Bridges and Goodman are top of their game. Do you know what, I'm going to watch it again right now, for about the hundredth time!

Review title: My Favorite Movie. Go rent it.
Review_body: There are so many things that I like about this movie.  First of all, I don't think there is another movie that has so many great quotes in it, not to mention that every character in the movie has their share of great quotes.  If you are looking for a movie to quote, look no further.Second, The Dude has the coolest style.  A guy obviously stuck in the Sixties, he carelessly and effortlessly slides through life without a job and has the best time at it.  A kind-hearted, innocent guy, he loves to bowl, get high, and listen to Bob Dylan.Third, the plot of this movie is excellent.  Dont be mis-led, there is very little apparent plot.  However, there is very much going on that is unsaid which makes the movie very complex and intricate.  To understand the motivations of the individual characters takes some concentration.  It took me many times of watching it to fully understand what each character had going on in his/her head.Fourth, the dialog is highly developed.  The conversations in this movie are so unlike most movies.  The characters continuously interrupt each other, change subjects, lose their train of thought, etc.  Such a refreshing departure from the cookie cutter Hollywood film.  But yes, there is an unusually high amount of obscenities.  However, this movie does not attempt to sugar-coat the vocabulary of real people, they keep it true-to-life.As with most of the other Coen brothers' movies, the underlying theme is this:  Something bad or illegal happens, and instead of the onlookers trying to help the victims, they decide to try to make a personal gain from the situation.A masterpiece!  10 out of 10.  Now go out and watch it.

How good is this film? I may be out of my element here, but I have to say it must be one of the finest movies ever made! It is so funny, so clever and so absolutely, stupefyingly brilliant. Given the habits of John Goodman and Steve Buscemi (best actor in hollywood-no question!) to steal every movie they are in, I didn't think it would work but I was proved wrong. This movie rules!

Review title: Funniest movie I have ever seen!
Review_body: The Big Lebowski, the funniest movie I have ever seen, is based around the life of "The Dude."  A parasite on society, who has only one life concern, bowling.  Played by Jeff Bridges, he embarks on a strange journey after Wu(the Chinaman) p****d on his rug that "tied the room together."  With the attempted help of his friend, bowling partner, and Vietnam vet, Walter(played by John Goodman), they try to solve the mystery of "where the f**k is the money?"  A must see for anybody who enjoys sarcasm and real humor, not some gimmick.

Review title: Personal Opinions Are Laid To Rest
Review_body: "The Dude abides", and rightfully so.  With their greatest piece of work yet, the Coen Brothers have created a masterpiece with "The Big Lebowski". Whether consciously or subconsciously the Coen's have painted the most life like picture of Hollywood that has ever been seen by the naked eye.  Raw, honest, and most of all hilarious "The Big Lebowski" tells the story of three good friends who's lives revolve around bowling.  Even when one of them, "The Dude" (Jeff Bridges), gets caught up in a case of mistaken identity they still focus on the bowling league.  This isn't all folks, HA! Anyone with half a brain will laugh at this movie, although anyone with the other half still in tact will surely see that even from Sam Elliot's opening monologue this entire film spoofs the hollywood process.  Regardless of whether you recognize this or not, personal opinions are laid to rest with this film.  It has been said that every individual has an individual personality but along with the dawn of this beautiful new Coen Brothers film is also the realization that there is not one person on this green old earth that can make it through "The Big Lebowski" without laughing.  It is packed so tight with jokes that it'll make your grandadie's constipation look like a piece of cake.  If you don't like this film or rate it anywhere below a 7 that is fine, for at that point of clicking the "vote" button with 7 or below you shall finally find that you are indeed retarded.  Proceed to the doctor's immediately for treatment, because if you rate this film 7 or below you are in need of medical attention.  Personal opinions are laid to rest!

This film had glowing recommendations from so many people.  The Big Lebowski had an intriguing plot idea, and some very good performances, e.g. from John Goodman in particular. It is just that I can't bear the 'Oh so clever' style of the Coen brothers films. It seems they put a lot of effort into being quirky just as an end in itself, and this film was no different.There is nothing wrong with dream sequences, off the wall dialogue etc. Far from it. They feature strongly in some of my favourite movies of the last 30 years. I am a huge fan of David Lynch for example. But this film has a sense of desperation on the part of the filmmakers. That feeling of End of Year film school project about it. Like the geeks who watch the great movies and want to distill all the best bits into their own creation, but just don't get that you can over-egg it and whackify it so much that it simply becomes awfully tedious. There are probably a lot of people out there who admire the intentions of a film like the Big Lebowski, without stopping to think: 'Did they actually laugh?' I felt like I ought to at times, without actually getting near.

Review title: This movie is amazing...truly a masterpiece.
Review_body: Detailed in every scene, rich characterization, diverse soundtrack, witty real life dialogue. This movie is God. I feel that it takes a lot from a movie to make me leave with a sense of satiation, but this movie does it for me. Wonderfully written and directed by the Coen brothers, it is yet another masterpiece from them. Another thing is, that this movie never tries to be funny. It doesn't have random quirky characters or punch lines, it all comes from the scenes, very naturally. 10 out of 10. And how cool is the scene when the sheriff throws and hits The Dude in the forehead with the mug, and the mug doesn't turn while it's in the air! So many great scenes.

This was the movie that brought me round to Jeff Bridges the actor. He always annoyed me before with his pompous type characters but in this he is superb. He made me laugh constantly throughout the movie. I always loved the Coen's work as it is just beautifully shot and conceived - always interesting without moving too far from the joy of the story. The Big Lebowski is my favourite Coen movie because it deals with a more common theme and is easy to relate to. Jeff Bridges character I could watch all day and sometimes I wish there could be a follow up movie. The story is full of superb characters and settings, whilst the soundtrack is excellent. Do yourself a favour and see this film.

Review title: The Best Movie of All Time!!
Review_body: This is the funniest movie ever. Watch it you won't be disappointed! "I wouldn't hold out much hope for the Creedence". Even Tara (pre lipo-dappled tummy) Reid is good as a gold digging trophy wife of the "big" Lebowski. But, hands down funniest, greatest role of the movie goes to Dan Goodman as Walter. He will have you rolling in the aisles as they say. Go get yourself some jellies, a man cardigan and a "caucasian" and enjoy this delectable offering from the Coen brothers. About one man's quest to get his rug back, this movie is original, funny, features bowling........what more could you want???? There is a reason that random strangers can quote Lebowski with you - every line is a gem.

Its very hard to release a completely original movie and it be worth watching.  EXAMPLE:  Natural Born Killers.  NOT WORTH WATCHING...but yet completely original. The Big Lebowski is one of the best Coen Brothers movies.  The best being O Brother Where Art Thou?  I am not a big fan of Fargo.  I like my movies good.  Fargo wasnt. Anyways, The Big Lebowski is about american's other favorite past time...BOWLING, and a few bums who play it. Jeff Bridges proves he is an awesome actor in this movie playing 'The Dude.' Only a great actor can play a character like 'The Dude' and then a few years later get an Academy Award nomination for playing the President of the United States in 'The Contender.' The dream sequences in this movie are the funniest I have seen since 'National Lampoons European Vacation.' This movie rocked!

Review title: This aggression will not stand, man!
Review_body: Oh, so many great lines. The beauty of this is in the subtleties - the Dude hears something somewhere, doesn't really understand what it means, but uses it in conversation. "This aggression will not stand" he gets from George Bush and uses it on the Big Lebowski. "The parlance of our times" he steals from Maude and uses it on Brandt and the Big Lebowski. On and on."F*ck you man! You don't like my music, get your own f*ckin' cab!""I was in the music business, briefly...was a roadie for Metallica.""Leads? Sure, I'll just check down with the boys at the crime lab. They've got four more detectives on this case. They've got us workin' in shifts!""Where you goin', Dude?" "Home, Donnie." "Phone's ringin', Dude." "Thank you, Donnie!""Wouldn't out hold much hope for the tape deck, though." "Or the Creedence.""It's a league game, Smokey.""I told that clown a thousand times that I DON'T ROLL on SHABBAS!" "But they already posted it." "WELL THEY CAN F*CKIN' UN-POST IT!""I'm just gonna go find a cash machine.""Mind if I do a jay?""That some kind of Eastern thing?""Ze pigs en blanket.""Say what you will about the tenets of National Socialism, Dude, at LEAST it's an ETHOS.""His girlfriend gave up her toe! She thought we would get ze million dollars! It's not fair!"

I've seen this movie about 9000 times, but one line remains a mystery to me. In the scene where Walter tells The Dude that The Jesus is a pederast, the following conversation takes place:Walter: So how much did they give you? Dude: 20 grand man, and of course I still get to keep the rug. Walter: Just for making the hand-off? Dude: Yeah, they gave the dude a beeper...so whenever these guys call... Walter: What if it's during a game? Dude: Oh, I told them that if it was during leagueplay... Donny: What's during leagueplay? Walter: Life does not stop and start at your convenience, you miserable piece of s***.My question is about this last line. Who is Walter talking to? It seems unlikely that he's talking to The Dude, because I don't think he would call The Dude a 'miserable piece of s***'. Well, he could, but only when emotions are rising. This seems not to be the case in this scene. On the other hand: if he's talking to Donny (who ís always interfering at his convenience) his timing is way off (his reaction would be way too fast)!Any ideas?

Review title: A lifestyle film of the aging hippie
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is a rare comedy in that it makes you laugh at the reasons for the Dude's behavior rather than at the absurdity of the situations he is in.  It's not a detective/comedy and it sure as hell isn't a bowling comedy; it's a lifestyle movie with wonderfully written characters.  Jesus is a perfect example of comedic genius with a flat character.  He's a pedophile bowler that has the ability to intimidate guys like the Dude, who probably doesn't really even care enough to be intimidated. But that's the type of conflict that this movie deals with.  The Dude and Walter never really learn any lesson or go through any major character changes.  You must keep in mind that this movie is just a crazy story whose main purpose is to express the comedic traits within the characters.  Fans of character conflict should love this aspect.  Those looking for a buildup and climax may not appreciate the story so much.  The whole detective story is given to the audience blatantly.  But, like the Dude, you become wrapped up in the craziness of all the distractions from the cast of characters such as Autobahn that are thrown into the mix.  So when the story ends, you feel like the Dude; someone who just drifted along as everything sort of passed right by you. But worrying about all of it would be very un-Dude.

Review title: The Dude Abides, and Shatters the Comedy Genre Single-Handedly
Review_body: I've watched my share of comedies, and in all this time I've only been able to single out four as definitive and making a mark on the movie industry and establishing themselves as classics: Ghostbusters (the first one, mind you), Caddyshack (also only the first), National Lampoon's Animal House, and (drum roll please), The Big Lebowski. Let's discuss that last one further, shall we? The Big Lebowski follows the story of Jeffry "The Dude" Lebowski, an L.A. bum who gets sucked into the underground crime scene, drugs, sex, rock and all. I can't really give away more info than that without spoiling something, so that's all I will say in regards to the plot. On the character side of the movie, the whole film is comprised of bums, thugs and wackjobs, all who are lovably bizarre. While the characters all seem to have one-track minds, you never seem to tire of them and are all amusing in their own way (for example, Walter constantly tells Donny to "shut the f**k up", Donny is always almost completely unaware of what's going on throughout the movie, The Dude always says some witty one-liner that lightens the mood the way any stoner could, etc.). The script is absolutely hysterical and top-notch, as can be expected of the Coen brothers, and the acting is completely believable, despite how far out the dialogue and events are. How could anybody forget The Dude's reaction when they drag him out of the limo while he's drinking a White Russian? Well, here it is: "Whoa whoa, h-hey dude, careful, I've got a beverage here!" Overall, I loved everything about the movie. It's an incredibly fresh, original movie that can't possibly be put in any specific genre it's so unique. Here's a warning though: the first time you watch it, you might not enjoy it as much as the next time, as it's one of those movies that gets better with age. This can perhaps attribute to the commercial and critical failure it exhibited upon release, but since has grown so huge, that they have made a convention for it named Lebowskifest. Once you get sucked into the wild world of The Dude, you will never want to leave.

Review title: About the best movie I've seen
Review_body: The thing about TBL, is if you have never seen it, it sounds like the most boring film of all time. I find myself chuckling to myself and when my wife asks why, I will quote a part of the film, laugh some more and then she threatens to leave me!! The film is clever on so many levels. First of all it picks a time in history where very few movies back track to, it pick a subject matter that very few films pick ( bowling, porn movies, nihilists etc etc). Great performances, Jon Goodman especially was just made for the role. Above all the script for this film is so tight that you can watch this film time after time and not get tired of it and Goodmans speech on the cliff to the dead Donny is one of the greatest bits of film ever.

Review title: I Never Thought Perfection Would Be So Funny!!
Review_body: Before I met "The Dude" and the rest of the cast I wasn't sure if the Coen Brother's could ever top their Citizen Kane(Fargo). After watching "The Big Lebosky" I found out just how talented these writer/director's were. The Big Lebosky is a genre trend setting masterpiece. With dialogue so close to perfection I would not change a single sentence. This is a movie of pure clever genius and has tremendous replay and stay power. Mark my words when I say: You can watch it a million times, and you will never get sick of it.The story begins with the raspy southern drawl of "The Stranger"(Sam Elliot) preparing us with narration as the ever schlepped "Dude" (Jeff Bridges, Jeff Lebosky) isreturning home from buying some milk at the grocery store.Upon arriving home he is greeted by a couple of Jackie Treehorn's (notorious pornography producer) looking for "Jeff Lebosky" After realizing that the"Dude" was not in fact the right "Jeff Lebosky" (and one pee'd on rug and thus plot set up later)The Henchmen exit. Thus we are brought along on one of the funniest and darkest tales of redemption, slacking, anger, mistaken identity, and league bowling! I can honestly say the best ride of my life was on the not so righteousand lethargic tale of "The Dude" While he tries to seek reparation for the "soiled upon rug" in his living room, and finds himself in the midst of doing so, getting involved with so many different forms of deception, unwanted responsibility and paranoia as The Dude agrees to act as courier when the other millionaire "Jeffery Lebosky's"(David Huddleston) kidnapped trophy wife "Bunny"(Tara reed) allegedly gets kidnapped.Needless to say The Dude is in well over his head and Murphy's Law soon becomes reality to the motley crue of characters .This movie is so cleverly written you wonder just how the plot gets pulled off with such grace. And the answer to that question lays in the A. The dialogue B. The character development And C. The amazing acting from the entire castAs also starring "Walter Sobcheck"(John Goodman) "Theodore(Donny) Karabatsos"(Steve Buscemi)"Maude Lebosky"(Julianne Moore)Guest starring "Jesus Quintana"(John Turtorro) "Brandt"(Phillip Seymour Hoffman)ETC.And all these actors, no matter how small the part all make a juxtaposing impact On the all around greatness factor of this films hilarity and tightness But make sure you relax your face muscles the night before watching this moviebecause the best of the best in my personal opinion comes from "The Dude and Walter"(Bridges and Goodman) as "The Dudes" Pacifism mentality counteracts with the Ever un predictable and over steam headed Vietnam veteran "Walter Sobcheck"(Goodman)who will take any chance he can get to turn a conversation into reminiscing about his life in the war. With that being said Also turning in an unforgettable performance is "Julianne Moore" as "Maude Lebosky" the daughter of millionaire business man "Jeffrey Lebosky"(Dave Huddleston) The on screen chemistry between these cast members is extremely memorable and sometimes confrontational, but always entertaining and clever. When you view it for yourself, You'll find yourself quoting and watching in awe,as these actors quickly become your bowling buddies and transform the silver screen into pure gold. this masterpiece of satirical cinema will intrigue your intellect and challenge your sense of humor and boundaries as The Big Lebosky will invade your personal space by remaining in your mind and everyday references of the films idiosyncrasies will become adjacent to your vocabulary. Pare all that with the groundbreaking camera work and all star soundtrack and you have a film that comes as close to perfection as you will ever find.All in all and pound for pound "The Big Lebosky" is a 10! A true Timeless piece of film. The Coens Sistine Chapel if you will.So "Ever thus to the deadbeats" that choose not to enjoy!! But hey " that's just like... My opinion man!"By Anthony S. Timo

Review title: Wow, dude, you have to see this movie!!
Review_body: This film is a masterpiece of frivolity, invention and homage. Although Bridges is superb as the dude, the deadbeat 90s reincarnation of the film noir detectives of yesteryear, and the setpieces are truly memorable, the show is stolen by Goodman's ferocious Vietnam vet. He manages to play the frustration of paranoia and impotence within the constraints of compassion and, above all, loyalty. Hijacking the dude's every move, he muscles in on the chance to escape the boredom of his provincial life and glowers through the entire movie.Of course, these are not the only notable performances from the Coens' familiar cast. The film is helped by a host of SUPERB supporting performances (Buscemi's put-upon bowling pal, Turturro's latino pederast and the awkward PSH particularly spring to mind) - and the script is just amazing. This film is destined to become a classic.It is punctuated with moments of genius (from the best golfing gag ever through the North by Northwest pencil tracing homage, and the most painful "hit in the face with..." scene on film) and beautifully shot throughout (the bowling ballet opening sequence and Jesus' Hotel California are a joy to behold). And the narrator could not have been better chosen.The film does maybe lack the melancholic, disciplined humour of Fargo, but it is just as good a film in other respects.I recommend you buy, rent or steal a copy right now and enjoy yourself thoroughly!!!

Review title: Undoubtedly the best film ever made
Review_body: It simply has all a healthy human should seek from a film.

after viewing "the dude" at least 30 times, i must say it has taken a zen-like quality.  all the mysteries of life can be explained by "the dude."   the film is the beginning, the middle, and the end.

Review title: Just had to change my rating
Review_body: I rated this as a 9 but realised it was ridiculously low. I have seen the film many times. The film is funnier and more profound each time I watch it. It is the crowning achievement of the Coen's if you have seen it watch it again, if you have not seen it - YOU MUST WATCH THIS FILM.

The Big Lebowski transcends the typical boundaries of slapstick humor, and replaces them with a deeper, more meaningful cinematic work.The acting in this movie is more than simply well done. John Goodman performs in one of the most hilarious comedy roles to date, and Jeff Bridges undergoes the transformation to "The Dude" easily. A brilliant movie with a great punchline, constant laughs, and stereotype-knocking gags make this a must see.
Rating: 9 of 10

So far I've thoroughly enjoyed all the Coen Bros. Films I've seen. Until now. A misfit bunch of characters trying so hard to be larger than life succeeded only in making me cringe. So much so that I had a headache afterwards. Decent enough plotline and story, but really, the acting was OTT. And, sorry, Julianne Moore, that accent was more Dick van Dyke than Mary Poppins.So, to summarise: meh!

This is the funniest movie I have ever seen, although I didn't have that opinion until after I had seen it about 4 times. It took my a few viewings to really catch everything. The key is that you have to watch this movie without really worrying about the plot. You just have to enjoy the characters and the dialogue, which in every scene, without fail, is as witty as any I've ever seen.It's the kind of movie you'll memorize, repeat parts of over and over, and watch over and over, enjoying it more each time. Every character in it has a unique charm, and despite the fact that they are all pretty much cartoonish caricatures, they all somehow have depth, and the interplay among them is just priceless. This is funny stuff. One of the most underrated movies ever.

Review title: You can watch it a million times, and yet, it will never get old
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is the type of movie that is so funny, and so clever, you want nothing more but to meet the Coen brothers, congratulate them personally for their unique talent, and get inside their heads and find out what makes these two geniuses "tick".  The main characters are Jeff Bridges (who plays such broad roles like The Muse, The Contender, and Sea Biscuit), John Goodman (who should have won an oscar for best supporting actor for his character, Walter Sobchak)Juliane Moore (Maude Lebowski)and Steve Buscemi (who is unique in every Coen Brother movie).The first time I saw this movie, I will admit that I enjoyed it, but did not fully appreciate its level of humor and raw talent.  I thought the middle section was a bit too depressing and long.  But trust me, this is a movie that gets more funny every time you see it, even if it's your thousandth time seeing it. Its level of comedy, action, brutality, and vulgarity become that much more evident and important.The characters are brilliantly written by the coen brothers, and, likewise, are brilliantly portrayed by the actors.  The Big Lebowski is like no other film.  It will make you laugh and it will make you cry.  There is no other film such as TBL that is sharp and witty all the way through. One of the Joel and Ethan Coen's best, and one of the movie industry's best comedic film of all time.  You want to go see this flick.

While Fargo, Millers Crossing, O'Brother Where Art Thou and Raising Arizona (not to mention all there other films), are fantastic peices of work, The Big Lebowski stands far higher than any other in my opinion. I cant think of how many times i've watched this film, but it keeps getting funnier! Perfect dialogue, perfect casting, totally Coen brothers, utterly amazing!! Jeff Bridges has never been better, along with John Goodman and Steve Buscemi delivering top notch perfomances. Any one who says The Big Lebowski is not a comedy doesn't know humer, anybody can crack a fart joke! But to be able to write witty, clever and just down right histerical dialogue are true gods, all hail the Coens!!!

Review title: The green toe gets the green vote!
Review_body: Joel and Ethan Coen's 'The Big Lebowski' is an absolute cult classic! This film created 'The Dude' as one of the most iconic characters in film. The slow witted, care-free stoner played by Jeff Bridges makes for a hilarious character with biting satire and tongue and cheek humor. He is also complimented with John Goodman's character, Walter, as a Vietnam veteran who can't seem to not relate things to the Vietnam war. His cool and calm personality overshot with an immediate burst of rage conveys a contrast which is both hilarious and extremely entertaining. His character is also famous for the quote "shut the f*** up, Donny" and "Am I the only one here who gives a f*** about the rules?" which resonates in pop culture references today. The great soundtrack featuring famous artists such as Creedence and Johnny Cash really emulate the context of the film and attribute to the overall mood of the oxymoron phrase 'chilled-out- mayhem'. However, this satirical humor is not for everyone, which can really take away from the film for some people. Overall, the story is quite good and the characters are excellent! The amazing surrealist dream sequences also create an atmosphere of 1970's Woodstock and the generation of free-love (and habitual marijuana smoking). All in all, this is a masterpiece and the Coen brother's best film ever!

Review title: The Big Lebowski is a very clever movie
Review_body: The big Lebowski is my favorite movie,it may not be the best according to some, but it's a very clever and original movie. Some of the humor doesn't "jump out"at you like in other comedy movies, instead you more or less have to think about what is going on in the film to see the humor in it. The Big Lebowski is a classic, one of the Coen Bros. best, but only recently have I noticed more people watching the movie and enjoying it. I think as more people see the movie that they may have missed the Big Lebowski will gain more respect. For those of you that saw it on Comedy Central, your missing out on a lot of "R" rated comedy. Rent the DVD sometime and you'll know what I'm talking about here.

Review title: Relaxing to watch, when feeling stressed.
Review_body: Well, what can I say. It's one of my favourite movies when I feel distressed in the daily s***. This movie makes me feel whole again in one way. Like I don't have to do something, that I just have to live my life, without any bosses or other people who wants to say what I have to do.I gave this movie an 8, it could also be a 9 or 10, because it's just a number. Numbers don't say everything. Well, now I regret that I haven't give it a 9.I recommend this movie for people who come home from a hell of a daily work-day and want to commit suicide. This movie will hold you from doing that.The Dude....yesss...it's just the dude.

Hearing so many great reviews I at last decided to watch it. Was looking forward as I sat down with a few chilled guinness. Problem was I didnt know what to make of the film, was it serious or a comedy? It was too stupid to be serious, and it wasnt funny enough to be a comedy. We had an unemployed bum who drank white Russians all day get caught up in a plot, this was so silly and unbelievable that I was soon bored,hoped it would get better but it didnt. If it had a good storyline or was funny I would have liked it,but it was neither. How people said this was a great film is beyond me.

Review title: A must have, must watch, piece of cinematic genius.
Review_body: In every great directors career there is a film where all the stars align. The script is perfect, the acting is impeccable and the movie seems to just magically fall into place. The Coen brothers could have not put together a more well balanced and enjoyable film, this is there defining moment, this will be there masterpiece.Years later audiences still enjoy the story of "the Dude" (Jeff Bridges) and his laid back approach to life, not to mention his love of bowling with his eclectic mix of friends - Walter (John Goodman) and Donny (Steve Buscemi). This is a tale of intrigue and layered complexity that is only reserved for the finest of films with stellar performances by the whole cast, including a legendary performance by John Turturro as "The Jesus".As we wait for the next generation to discover this cinematic gem. This film will abide, as will The Dude.

Review title: Cult classic with great performances... only gets better with age
Review_body: Is it just me or has this movie progressively gotten better every year since it was released like 8 years ago?Just the setting of the film, the brilliant performances by John Goodman, Jeff Bridges, Phillip Seymour Hoffman, John Turturo, Julianne Moore, David Huddleston (millionaire lebowski)... besides it's so well written and is just a riot. How many memorable lines can you fit in one movie? Lebowski is great as an almost tragic/flawed hero figure. He's a hard luck lazy stoner, yet you still get a feeling of greatness from him. From some of the things he tells us about his past and from his respected presence in the film, he's just truly a classic, unforgettable movie character. I still think the best role in the film is played by Goodman, who is absolutely f**king brilliant as Walter. I mean, admit it- who didn't forgive him for 8 years of Roseane on the spot? I like the slight philosophical under-text of the film and all the archetypes it portrays between the Dude, Walter, the Millionaire Lebowski, Maude Lebowski, nihilism, pacifism - and using it all as a punchline is hysterical.Oh, and Turturo is immediately in the running for 'most memorable comedy cameo ever' with Jesus, the perverted foul-mouthed sh*t-talker. You said it man, a true cult classic in every sense.

Review title: One of the best films, period - Dude!
Review_body: Come on! This is the best film ever. i', even raising this above LOTR, since this is contemporary. I grew up living like the Dude. The Dude reminds me of my Uncle...not in a bad way, but with deep respect to living one's own life.The Coen brothers have created a film to be topped, if it was possible. Barton Fink was great..Fargo, yeah it was exceptional story-telling. But, the Dude - that was well-crafted cinema.The only other film that I have seen of theirs that captured me as much was No Country for Old Men.Can't wait for the next surprise!

Review title: Never judge this movie based on your 1st viewing. Also if you loved the movie on the very 1st viewing then you're just lying or pretending.. Keep rewatching to love this one
Review_body: I don't write reviews for movies with high ratings as they already have overflowed reviews praising how great they are... But this movie deserves even more appreciation than it actually deserves...Watched this in 2015 when i wasn't very fond of english movies with more dialogues, profanities and black humor... I was just the kind of guy who watched english movies for non stop action... So i tried to explore more genres for interesting plotlines and the movies i chose to watch were very bad choices at that time... Big Lebowski was one of them... I wasn't ready for this kind of humor at that time... Concentrated too much on the kidnapping subplot and i lost all the fun in the movie... Ended up hating it for no reason...6 years later, after watching almost 700+ english movies and with a high taste for silly and black humor comedies i decided to rewatch this again... Felt so great for a midnight watch... Literally didn't care about the plot or the kidnapping sub plot... and that did the magic... With the no.of characters and their subplots you may expect the movie to be many things but it's never turns out to be the way you expect it... and that's the best thing about this movie... Watch it just for the funny dialogues (especially shut the f up donny gig), soundtrack, stylish cinematography and the brilliantly placed "Jackie Treehorn's short film"... There's more things so cool in this movie but it is not posssible to simply write them down here... Just watch and you'll understand... You'll enjoy this more than what you expected... And this movie will get better even more better with every rewatch...Highly recommended for midnight watch...

This movie is sort of like a circus minus the clowns and the freak show; everything about it is attractive and entertaining. The characters are deep and interesting, and even the most minor of characters have their own unique personality. The camera work is ingenious, as are the visuals and costumes. The comedy comes in from all sides, whether subtle, witty, or straightforward. The Coen Brothers use stereotypes and wording like Van Gough used a brush. It is one of those few movies where almost every line is quotable and easily recognizable. Unlike most comedies (if you could call it such) the story is both followable and enjoyable. One of the true masterpieces of our time. If you don't like this movie, I'm sure you hate to laugh.

Review title: Simply put, this IS the movie that defines the 90's
Review_body: Like I said in the summary, simply put, this is the movie that defines life in the 90's. The Dude, as the narrator so eloquently puts it, is the man for his place and time. Although he defines laziness, and The Dude is lazy, he is a hero. But what is a hero? I'll stop stealing lines from the movie and just say that this is one of the best put together movies of all time. It is a cult classic and I can't imagine why it's not more mainstream, but it is clever, original, and I must say that John Goodman as Walter Sobchak is one of the best characters to ever grace the big screen. If you've seen this movie, I'm confident you'll agree. This is one of the few films that can be silly and real at the same time. To put it bluntly, this is a must see if you haven't seen it, and if you have, watch it again; it only gets better!

Review title: You are not privy to the new s***
Review_body: This is my number two all time favorite movie. Why? This movie is an onion. Even now years after it's release, I watch it and the layers unfold. What I have discovered is that the movies that somehow, mysteriously move me in unknown ways upon the first viewing turn out to be religious metaphors. Blade Runner. Pretty obvious if you at least a faint whiff of imaginative ability. The Big Lebowski is more subtle. Watch the movie and count how many times "Jesus" is said. Was Jesus betrayed by the Jews? He was in TBL. It's all there. An "immaculate conception", a betrayal, a crucifixion, a rebirth. Who is the Jesus metaphor? It's the car. The car carries the characters throughout the movie and is sacrificed in the end by nihilists. The car carries the reward, the million dollars, that turns out not to be there because the money is not the reward. Bowling is the reward. Donny is reborn as The Dude and Walter return to the lanes. The idolater falls. Maude becomes the next Mary Magdelene. Walter is Paul. The Dude is John. Not even the Cohen brothers can escape the Judeo-Christian core of our society. Of course, escape is not necessary. If Jesus can't f*** you on Saturday, he'll f*** you next Wednesday. Hey, check out my album, Tacos and Bowling on itunes: http://phobos.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/ viewAlbum?playListId=39322321 We all abide.

Review title: The essence of a simple story told well
Review_body:
Simplicity: There's nothing ground breaking in the story. In actuality it's really quite simple. The real enjoyment in this movie is how well the story is told.
Characters: Everything down to the eccentricity of the characters (and the script) is what keeps you engaged at all times. It's not if Bonnie was kidnapped, who kidnapped her and who has the money. It's actually more about each character and the interactions drawn from the variance of each of their personalities that light up the movie. From Jeff Lebowski and his facade of wealth and collectiveness, Maude and her band of odd friends, Walter and his flash-back Nam infused angry interactions, the nihilists and their strange ferret intimidation techniques to Donny and his pitied like-ability.
Unpredictability: You can never really tell what's going to happen from one scene to the next, it's far from predictable. The story takes a series of turns with the viewer never really guessing what or who is going to pop up next - that for me, is probably what differentiates the exceptional directors from the good.
Script: It's those little touches such as how The Dude recites what he hears and picks up around him and uses it in latter interactions with the other characters; that level of detail is what separates it from other movies. The conversations are fun and the dialogue among characters interesting.

Review title: The Big Lebowski is One Big Laughbowski
Review_body: There are many things to love about movies; the smell of popcorn, the taste of butter, the John Goodman moments, and of course, the Big Lebowski. If you like to laugh at one deadbeat stoner who has a passion for oriental rugs, and forgets to comb his hair, you will love this movie. It is written by the Coen brothers, who have wrote about a thousand great movies. Unfortunately they are dead now, but this movie is still alive. MY favorite thing about this movie, the reason why it gets 9 stars, every single line is mildly funny. Of course, you cannot laugh out loud at every single line, but you will find yourself giggling inside every time John Goodman opens his mouth. God, so funny. Watch this movie sober or not...your choice! Either way, funny as hell. At one point the Dude is tripping on a illicit substance...oh my god, the cinematography is amazing!!! The viewer is experiencing a TRIP in someone else's perspective. Very novel and unique. I watch this movie whenever I can with friends. You should do the same :)

Review title: This very well may be the best comedy I have ever seen
Review_body: In my short 25 years of life I have seen a decent amount of movies, missing out on some of the classics from before my time, however I would still say that for the right sense of humor this movie is nearly perfect.This movie is very dialog oriented, which to some extent necessitates that you get to know the characters to really understand why some things are funny. I personally loved this movie when I first saw it but probably would have only a given it an 8. The more you watch it however, the more your knowledge of the characters from the fist viewing build very quirky and nuanced personalities that make the characters very real and yet surreal. This makes it that much better, when you hear some of the comments because you know where they came from, just as if you heard of something that a friend did and depending on who that friend was, it makes their actions that much funnier.There are flaws in every movie, but what matters is do they bother you or not, and I don't remember any that do, and I have seen the film at least ten times. Each time just as good as the last, and this is what makes this movie so special is repeatability. You can watch it and start it over right afterwords and laugh just as hard.John Goodman should have at least been nominated for a best supporting actor as he is excellent in this movie as Walter. Also, John Turturro is excellent as "the Jesus" in a limited role. Other actors turn in very good performances as well. I think you need the right sense of humor for this movie to work for you, but everyone that I do know that likes it, loves it and that makes it worth viewing, because if it does work for you, you will understand where the genius is located in this film and you will love it as well.I won't mention any details about the film, because thats what the film is for and frankly if I tried to summarize it it just wouldn't do the movie justice.See it sometime when you're bored, and hopefully you will see what I see in what I still say is the best comedy of the 90's

All of the elements that comprise this film are superb. The script is hilarious upon first viewing, but becomes ingenious with each subsequent viewing afterwards. I try to use big words to sound pretentious because the film makes me feel inadequate because of its amazing craftsmanship. The filming itself is beautiful, especially the slow-motion tracking shots. The mannerisms and characters are what truly make this film shine. The repetition and over-assertion of each character is so over the top that it reaches the point of absolute hilarity.before you watch this film, ask yourself one question: "mind if i light a j?"

Review title: The Big Lebowski is the best mess you could watch.
Review_body: The first time you watch The Big Lebowski you tend to find it messy and not very coherent, but that's exactly what the movie needs. The Big Lebowski isn't about the dude or his rug, it's not about bunny and her problems with known pornographers, it's not about Jeff Lebowski giving the dude a ringer, and it's definitely not about Donny. Shut the f*** up Donny. No, the movie is really about the characters. Its about watching these very imaginative characters and their mannerisms. Its about watching how they act and react with one another and seeing how their personalities get them in and out of tough situations. Ultimately the plot is so messy because the Coen brothers don't want you to focus on the details on why what is happening or what motivation brought these characters here. There is but one motivation in the movie that matters, the dude wants his rug back and he just wants to get it back without having to bother anyone. The situation these characters are put in is what makes the movie funny and the way that they react is how we learn from these characters. Plot is important in some movies, but when the characters are the ones who have the story to tell, why not stop worrying and just listen to them. The next time you watch this movie, forget about what's happening and just enjoy these hilariously inapt characters navigate their way through the mess that is The Big Lebowski.

This is a plot and dialogue that perhaps only the Coen Brothers could have devised. I'm thinking less of their clarity in "Fargo" and "No Country for Old Men" than of the almost hallucinatory logic of "Raising Arizona" and "The Hudsucker Proxy." Only a steady hand in the midst of madness allows them to hold it all together--that, and the delirious richness of their visual approach.Anyone who cares about movies must surely have heard something about the plot. This is a movie that has inspired an annual convention and the Church of the Latter-Day Dude. Its star, Jeff Bridges, has become so identified with the starring role that when he won the 2010 Oscar for Best Actor, Twitterland mourned that his acceptance speech didn't begin with, "The Dude Abides." These words are so emblematic that they inspired a book title, The Dude Abides: The Gospel According to the Coen Brothers, by Cathleen Falsani. This is a serious book, though far from a dreary theological work.

Review title: The more times you watch this movie, the better it gets!
Review_body: To anyone that did not like this movie or gave it a bad review, please do yourself a favor and watch it again. I thought it was pretty good the first time I saw it but I would say it is great after the third and fourth times. Probably the most re-watchable movie ever made. Clever writing and great acting = One of the best Coen Bros movies, ever!1)Fargo 2)The Big Lebowski 3)No Country For Old Men. "Jackie Treehorn treats objects like women, man."

Review title: this movie is the best for a generation
Review_body: I believe every people who is between 20-45 age must watch this movie.

For so many reasons this is one of the best comedies you will ever see. If you enjoy quirky movies and a movie that will take your mind for a wild ride this is it. The cast is amazing. John Goodman steals the show as Walter. Between the Dude, the Stranger, and Jesus there are plenty of strange and hilarious characters. The story takes one turn after another and is in true Cohen Brother's form. I have seen this movie many times and still laugh out loud. Walter and the Dude go on a quest to replace his rug, it really tied the room together. In the process the Dude finds himself confused with the Big Lebowski who sends the dude on a wild task. In this movie each new character seems to top the one you just meet. Watch this movie!

I'm trying to be fair here and rating it 6/10. It's a descent movie, likely worth watching for most people. I watched it a few years back, before I really heard about it, and thought it was OK. I made it through the whole thing, but there were parts that dragged and it's also borderline depressing at times, but has enough humor sprinkled in to get me through. it IS quirky, and I can see how the 'cult classic' gets attached due to the repetition of certain comedic themes throughout. It's definitely not a 10/10 movie, and likewise the 1/10 reviews are basically just a reaction to it's overrating.I've heard a lot about how great it is since the first time I saw it, and recently just watched it again since it was free on TV. The second time felt just like the first...it was OK.

Review title: This is the best movie ever made
Review_body:
This is the best movie of all time, and I knew this right after I watched it. It's just perfect.
