Everything in this movie is perfect, the characters are outright interesting from the Dude who manages to keep his head cool by adhering to a strict drug regimen, his buddies, the hot-headed but hilarious Walter and clueless Donny, the other characters, Maude, Bunny, Jackie Treehorn, Jesus Quintana are also very interesting and add their own flavor to the movie. 
The whole story is a sort of whodunit mystery which turns out to be a much ado about nothing, much like life itself - and it was this hard hitting conclusion which made me realize that this is perhaps the best movie ever made.

This is one of the very few comedies that is still funny every single time you watch it. For what some might dub as a "stoner comedy," there's quite a lot going on this movie, and it's damn near impossible to catch everything on the first viewing. I wont get into the plot details, since I think it's best to watch it for the first time without knowing anything about it. Then watch it again a couple weeks later. I'll bet you laugh more the second time you see it. Office Space was the only other comedy that had this affect on me. Oh and one other thing. DO NOT WATCH THE EDITED VERSION ON TV! This movie is rated R for a reason, and if you watch the edited version you are missing half the movie.My highest recommendation.

Review title: The Best Comedy FilM in the Last 25 years
Review_body: The Big Lewboski is among the best comedy films of all time, kind of. It has a very disjointed storyline, and is, at times, hard to follow (or comprehend). However, the writer allows enough latitude for the actors to make it work. The casting of Jeff Bridges as 'Dude' is central to the movie. I can't think of another actor that could have pulled this off as well as he did. It really tied the movie together.The Dude seems not to want anything but to be left alone. The uncertainty presented to him as the result of a case of mistaken identity (maybe) shatters the warm comfort that 'Dude' has spent his life creating and maintaining. It makes him very uncomfortable, and causes him to react accordingly. Walter is the Dude's salvation. He forces the 'Dude' to pursue the source of his discomfort. The more that Walter exerts himself, the better it gets. John Goodman's heroic, manic performance gave the movie the only sense of stability in an otherwise chaotic circumstance presented to the 'Dude'. Both Walter and 'Dude' are pretty intelligent, introspective and spiritual beings in their own rights. They just don't know it.I have no idea what Donny was doing in the movie, other than to have Steve Buschemi die in yet another Cohen brothers film. The dialog is wild. The Big Lewboski yelling 'The Plane has crashed into the mountain', Maudes discussion of the effect of vaginae on men, and all of The Jesus' scenes, down to his purple jump suit (The Purple Jesus) are bizarre. Everything coming out of the 'Dude's' mouth is very funny. Like 'A Night at the Opera' and 'The Producers' good comic actors, presented with the right opportunity, can take it over the falls. The more you watch this movie, the better it gets.

No idea. Huge waste of time! Fuggdaboudit FuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdaboudit FuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdaboudit FuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdabouditFuggdaboudit

Great movie. Coen Brothers and Roger Deakins how bad can it be .Take look at this , this movie has it's own religion called Dudeism.It derives from The Dude , the main character of the movie.The thing that made this movie irreplaceable is his responses to the incidents that happen to rather than the movies plot.Doubtlessly the most beloved character in this movie is 'The Dude' but we shouldn't forger Walter too.He is the guy that makes you laugh every single second as you watch. This movie also includes criticism about Vietnam war and other political cases that makes this masterpiece even better.If you really understand the characters and watch this movie with analyzing them without looking other components I have no doubt that you are gonna really enjoy this movie.And surely you're gonna envy the lifestyle of the dude. Moreover Jeff Bridges is definitely the best actor for playing The Dude. If you watched it and didn't like it . Yeah ,well, that's just, like, your opinion, man.

Review title: Why isn't this best picture winner
Review_body: This is one of my top 5 movies of all time a dialogue never seen since pulp fiction this movie became not only a lifestyle but a cinematic legend
I was a bit disappointed. I don't know what this film wasabout.

Review title: The Handbook For Making of The Perfect World
Review_body: My video Bible, the Big Lebowski is the best movie ever made. The dialog is unrivaled by any other movie--or book for that matter. One can spend hours, watching the movie a thousand times, and remembering every quote. But, the 1,001st time you watch it, you will find something new and funny that you never knew could be left in the film. The casting is perfect and spot-on for all portrayals of script characters. John Goodman performs in as close to a leading performance a supporting role can be. Jeff Bridges steals the show, as he was intended to do, and portrays possibly the best character ever filmed--The Dude. He integrates the intended simplicity of The Dude's lifestyle, with the chaotic complexity of his philosophies and personality. Absolutely a must-see for anyone who gives a damn about breathing.
One of the most watchable movies of all time. Quirky in all the best ways.
Dudeness or duder or the dude is a way of thinking or life style.Just relax and dont effort too much.That is the message of film

Review title: My favourite movie of all time
Review_body: Great comedy, great story, great characters and great acting. I really love this movie, and I have seen it over ten times. I'll be watching it again soon, and I advise, if you didn't like it, to try and put yourselves in the shoes of Jeffrey Lebowski and imitate him, for the duration of the movie. Thanks

Every time I watch this movie I get a big smile on my face. It is always entertaining. It is such a zany story. The characters are so memorable, and of course it makes you want to have white Russians which are delicious. It also makes me want to go bowling something I haven't done in so long! I think the acting is great. The Guy who played dude was perfect for the role. John Goodman was amazing he was so funny, and I alway enjoy Steve Bushemi or however you spell his name. This tale of wash up middled age misfits is great film making. It tickled the funny bone and it just fun to watch. Good acting and a twist on a simple concept really worked in this film. I have never met a person who doesn't like it! The Dude abides will live on...

Review title: Coen perfection - times like these call for a big Lebowski indeed.
Review_body: Joel and Ethan Coen have a unique ability to populate their films with fantastic quirky characters, and unbelievable imaginative visuals, and they have never done it as good as in The Big Lebowski.The Coens again delve into the world of kidnapping, this time the story centers around the kidnapping and ransom demands of a famous millionaire. The acting, comedic timing, direction and sharp writing make this film the funniest film in a long,long time (how could you forget this film, AFI).

The rug really tied the room together. This movie is my all time favorite and incorporates everything that you would ever want to see in a movie. It has nihilists, marmots, bowling, weed, porn stars, old western drifters, and much more. This movie gets funnier everytime I watch it. If you haven't seen it yet, put on your shoes, get in the car and drive down to the video store right now. Before you know it you'll be howling with laughter at Walter's continous shouts of 'Shut the f*ck up, Donny!'. Go see it, now!

The Big Lebowski is the greatest movie of all time, except for maybe Taxi Driver, but these films can't be compared.  I live in the real life Big Lebowski; I am exactly like Walter, my best friend is the dude, and Donny is a friend who is 6foot6 and pure irish.  We also have Jesus, who is my next door neighbor, he is Italian, a sick pervert amd everything, but the coolest thing about this movie is the entire thing is about the Dude's rug... it ties the room together man

Review title: Funny as Hell and Twice as Surreal
Review_body: This film is one of the most mind-blazingly funny (and I use that expression for no other reason than wanting to say "mind-blazingly) comedies I've ever had the pleasure of viewing. Perhaps it's my penchant for hyper-surrealist humor (Monty Python, Kids in the Hall, Upright Citizens Brigade, South Park, I could give two craps if you're insulted by the grouping, they're all warped and they're all hysterical), perhaps its that I finally found a movie that can satisfy the intellectual in me and still hold the attention of the slightly cerebrally-challenged around me whom I usually have to trick to see my kind of movie ("Dude, you better not have been lying about Woody Allen making a movie about Navy Seals"), but this film ranks up there with my all-time favorites. Incredibly quotable and utterly hysterical, this movie should be seen by anyone and everyone, and if they don't like it...well, that's just...like...their opinion, man.

Review title: #1 Comedy of 1998 (with the possible exception of "something about mary")
Review_body: How could anybody compare this movie to Fargo?  They are completely different movies, each amazing in diffrent ways.  I've seen Fargo over 20 times and Lebowski 6 times and I still couldn't tell you which one is better but i can tell you they don't lose anything after multiple viewings.  They both prove that the Coen brothers may be the best moviemakers in Hollywood today.  Lebowski is one of the few movies I've ever walked out of and wanted to walk right back in and watch it again.  I recomend this movie for anyone and everyone.

I had no control of the video when it was shown and due to circumstances, could not leave. The language in this movie is sickening. No one needs to hear "F" this and/or "F" that practically every sentence. What I will do is to tell people NOT to rent the movie.

Review title: i registered just to give a vote of 10 for this gem of gems
Review_body: bottom line: if you need to laugh, and laugh HARD, rent it.  watch it twice. watch it five times.  don't watch it 50 (like me), or you'll find yourself conversing in lebowskian dialect.it's the story of the Dude (Bridges), who, through a case of mistaken identity becomes mixed up in a debacle involving a host of characters from all walks of L.A. life.  the screenplay is terrific, the casting is nothing short of brilliant, and the story line, tho difficult to follow due to some, er, zany twists in plot and misinformation from the players, is very entertaining.  the cohn brothers invoke some marvelous theatrical tricks, especially video cuts in the middle of a conversation and extensive use of repetition (if something is funny once, it's bound to show up 2,3,5 more times).call it a cult flick, a sad commentary on the state of affairs in California, if not the US... bogus!  This movie is top notch, and it pokes fun at everything it seems to hold dear.  give it a second screening if it blew over your head the first time (as was the case for me), and i promise you'll be renting to own :D

Nothing else comes to mind when I hear somewone mention "The Big Lebowski". It is simply the best movie I have ever seen! The more stupid and outrageous it gets, the more hilarious it becomes. This movie includes everything that an excellent movie calls for; awesome casting job (Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Sam Elliot, Steve Buscemi, etc), humor nothing can deliver, bowling, some lazy guy named Dude, to some "self-described" Nihilists. The Coen Brothers have once again made movies more enjoyable. I highly recommend this flick for anyone who needs a good laugh.

This movie is simply fantastic.  The Coen brothers have once again outdone themselves.  Amazing imagery coupled with a fantastic, though brief, performance by John Turturro paints a hilariously poignant picture of the bowling subculture.  The Coen Brothers have long been known for paying less attention to the plot than they pay to the visuals and the interaction of their characters, and this film is no exception.  The plot is somewhat confusing and contains innumerable twists, but what lies at the heart of this movie is solid: The relationship that is developed between John Goodman and Jeff Bridges is funny, and it reveals quite a bit about their characters.  Overall I thought this movie was outstanding.  Even though it didn't reveal any eternal truths about the human spirit, I had fun while watching it, and that's all the truth I need.

Those who have said that this is not a good movie didn't understand one bit of it, or tried to understand too much. This is an 'awesome' movie (,man) and it is unique in the way it brings bottom-of-the-belly laughing (or: the instinctive, natural type of laughter if you'd like) to a modern genre that's hard to associate with humor. One of the best I've ever seen besides Jim Jarmusch's Down by Law. Not that it's comparable, but...In short, it's a very funny, yet intellectual look at life through the eyes of the bozos that we all are. Go see it!

Review title: Probably one of the funniest films involving John Goodman
Review_body: Often mistaken as one big acid trip (well, it is, but it's so much  more), this hilarious flick truly lets John Goodman shine.  I have yet to see him in anything funnier.  The rest of the cast just makes this movie something to be watched time and again.It's now 2nd on my alltime most watched list, behind only Monty Python and the Search for the Holy Grail (which I've logged over 100+ viewings, so it'll be hard to top)..

I think this is on of the funniest movies of all times, the characters (especially Goodman's) are so weird that you have to laugh on almost every line they say, go buy it! I gave it a straight ten. Also, Dude, people keep telling that the plot is not good or at least not as good as Fargo's. well that may be, but  therefore it was so funny and I think that the plot isn't so important here anyway. You'd miss most of it anyway cause you've got to laugh all the time. Also, try some White Russian during the movie it'll improve a lot if you don't like it.

Review title: Best Coen Brothers Flick to Date
Review_body: I personally think this is truly one of the great masterpieces of comedic film.  Awesome.  It offers so much nuance comedy that it becomes the type of movie you can watch about thirty times and still find new things to laugh at.  If you have not seen this movie, please do so ASAP, it will be good for you.

The Big Lebowski is my favorite movie. No other has such subtly masterful interaction with such colorful characters. It is not a high suspense thriller or a drama, but a fun-time feel good comedy that doesn't try too hard to get there. But isn't that what the movie is about.It's just about sitting back and enjoying the ride. I have seen it +20 times and it still has a friendliness about it. The action heats up just so often, but it doesn't disturb.There is so much slacker-ing that it sort of rubs off and makes you feel at peace just to sit there and take it all in. And it's real funny too.

This is definitely one of the smoothest movies ever.  The Dude is such a great character, no cares in the world.  John Goodman is also great, I love all his Vietnam flashbacks and his slamming Donny is hysterical!  If you haven't seen it then this is definitely a great movie to see!

I loved this movie when I saw it in the theater -- and it never gets old. There are so many moments in this movie that you just think about and chuckle over for days afterwards...Jeff Bridges is truly awesome as a lazy anti-hero.  But I really think every eccentric character in this movie shines, they're all doing something very different here...This is my favorite movie of all time.  I laugh every time I see it.  I really do!

The Big Lebowski is a must! It makes me think that there's still some great american movies, with UNpolitically correct attitude. Weird behaviour, weird thoughts, weird lifes: The Dude and his pals show how american movies can fit the european sense of humour. It's all about bowling and p***ing on a rug. Only the Coen brothers can make movies like that, and they must be thanked for this true jewel!
I thought this movie was off the wall and I loved it.  I really got a good laugh and a kick out of this movie.  Jeff Bridges' acting was excellent...very cool and calm.

Review title: Funny film full of great one-liners
Review_body: I'd seen no reviews or synopsis of this film when I picked it up in my video library. The fact that it was a Coen brothers film was enough to make me rent it. I was not disappointed. It's a warm, funny film full of great one-liners.Only the Coen's could take a rambling plot and laid back characters and tie it all up neatly together. For me, their finest.

>Superlatives ensue: I find the Big Lebowski to be exceedingly entertaining. The three main actors (Bridges, Buscemi and Goodman) did an extremely convincing job. In fact, it's hard for me to watch another movie with Jeff Bridges in it and not expect him to say, "new shit has come to light, man!"The convoluted plot comes ties together like a perfect episode of Seinfeld, and the scenes are shot beautifully, esp. the bowling and dream montages. The script is witty and hilarious without being juvenile and soooo many classic lines can be gleaned from it. This movie is a classic--you will laugh harder everytime you see it. The Sarsparilla man is right--it does make one feel safe knowing that "The Dude" is out there.

The first time I saw this great artwork of the Coen brothers I was really surprised that it is able to top "Fargo" and "Raising Arizona". Goodman's "You're entering a world of pain"-scene is the best of all in my opinion. "Mark it zero!" and "Have you ever heard of Vietnam?" are my all-time-favourite phrases of this movie and of course the destruction of "Lenny's" car was really awful! I can't get tired of watching this movie again and again and again!I'm giving this movie 23 points out of 10!

Review title: No, Dude, we don't mind if you do a J...
Review_body: It's the little things about a Coen-constructed universe (read "film") that make me laugh, and "Lebowski" is no exception.Case in point:The Dude is lazy, has no job and lives, er, slacks in Venice Beach, where he painfully scrawls out a check for $.69 for White Russian fixin's--specifically Half-and-Half--at the local supermarket.  Not exactly the most intelligent mind on the planet.  Yet he knows the exact street in North Hollywood where to find the In-N-Out burger (for those who are LA-challenged, North Hollywood is about 20 miles inland and worlds away from the beach).  Makes you wonder if somewhere in that hazy melon of his he knows every location in LA County.  Of course he knows this.  It would be out of character if he didn't.And another:At Jackie Treehorn's Malibu beach pad, Treehorn grills the half-baked Dude as to where Bunnie Lebowski might be.  Suddenly the conversation is interrupted by a phone call and Jackie scrawls info on a pad while on the phone.  We get the requisite zoom-in close-up as the Dude watches from across the room.  Jackie excuses himself and exits.  The Dude as Philip Marlowe rushes to the pad and lightly traces onto it.  Instead of an address or any useful info about the aforementioned phone conversation, he instead traces a picture of an man, shall we say, standing at attention.  Of course he does.  Treehorn is the self-described "publisher" who created "Logjammin'"...what else did you expect to find on the pad?!Now I'll concede that events like this can not possibly sustain a film, and I think "Lebowski" was lambasted because it is a film not about story, but about a collection of characters.  Funny characters. In fact, even the idea of taking a burn-out and dropping him in the middle of a convoluted Marlowe noir-like caper is enough to make me start laughing.Yes, the language is crude.  Yes, it sometimes feels like a collection of scenes strung together.  I will say, however, this film is incredibly funny and hits the mark again and again.

This movie quickly became my favorite film after seeing it as "El Gran Lebowski" in Chile this past summer. This is an artistically beautiful movie, with great character development, hilarious dialogue, gorgeous cinematography, and music that serves to bring it all together. Also a great movie if you're in an altered state of consciousness, if you know what I mean. John Goodman and Jeff Bridges make a wonderful comedic pair. This is yet another gem from the Coen Brothers.

Review title: It's about characters, it's about acting, and Jeff Bridges is Outstanding!
Review_body: I found Jeff Bridges' performance in this movie to be delightfully haunting. The supporting cast is strong, the plot is unpredictable, and the laughs are frequent.....the 'Dude' is straight out of the late 60's.....with Bridges absolutely *nailing* the character. Great movie, great portrayal.

The Big Lebowski - a virtual masterpiece.  Stunning visuals, from excellent dolly shots to amazingly trippy aerial sequences.  Add to it the wacky perspective which made Fargo so great, and you can see why Lebowski is another hit.  Great performances from Bridges, Goodman, Buscemi, and Turturro.  Turturro's character alone is enough to get the repeat viewer laughing. . .and everything else will take care of the first timer.  Read Drewzus' review. . .this is hilarious.  Side-splitting.  A comic masterpiece which cannot be overlooked.  Yeah.  "The Dude, duder, El Dudorino if you're not into the whole brevity thing."

Just as some people hate Jim Carrey's movies (I do), I can perfectly imagine that some will not find this film funny. If you have a slightly 'stupid' sense of humour (i.e. if you appreciate the ridicule, like, for example, what the Monty Python do), you'll just love this film. Personally, I found it so funny that I was crying.

Review title: Without a doubt, one of the greatest movies ever made!
Review_body: Even while pressing myself during a period of neurotic fits, I was not able to come up with a more perfect film.  Funny to no end, chalk full of ingenuity, poignant as a red clam, this film has it all.  A movie so good, that watching it is like eating a little slice of heaven.

I use this film as a vitamin pill! It is so well made, with so many small crazy or should I say normal things that goes wrong. Some of it reminds me of myself when I am having one of those days where everything goes wrong.Did I laugh when the Dude hammered the chair to the floor against the door so nobody could get in..... Jeff Bridges plays so well, he should have had an Oscar for this role. I keep watching this film again and again, and new things to laugh at appears every time.This is just my sense of humor! It is brilliant and cleverly made. Fargo was great too. I wonder if there are any other films made by these same people, in such case I must watch them.

Review title: Satirical and comedic genius at work
Review_body: Okay, so the language is extremely rough, probably the highest number of f words to ever be uttered in a movie. But in a decade chock-full of trashy, pathetic attempts at comedy, The Big Lebowski is a refuge that is the most original comedy in years. Jeffery "The Dude" Lebowski, with his laid back attitude, gets mixed up in a screwy plot of misunderstanding and just plain idiocy. His buddy Walter, the scene-stealer, the Vietnam vet. Walter's personality and foul-mouthed rants create a crude but hilarious comedic effect. The dialogue is witty throughout the movie, full of sarcasm and political satire, and must be listened to carefully to be sure none of the punchlines are missed, as this movie could be a radio program and barely lose any of the humour. I warn you that this movie bores anyone bearing a sense of humour that is unwilling to endure such an absurd comedy.

you must watch this film at least 3 times to fully appreciate its brilliance.  jeff was born to play this part.  he does dude so well that whenever you see him in any other role, you will think bl.  the acting in this film is truly the finest i have ever witnessed.  many people disagree because it is a comedy.  they think that oscar caliber acting should be reserved for dramas.  rent this one and watch it alone, concentrate, let the dude embrace you,  let yourself embrace the dude, be one with the dude and you shall see the light.  grasp the greatest lesson. abide.

Review title: I got a beverage here man!
Review_body: This movie is like a big, great Three's Company episode in a way.  Constant misunderstandings.  Note that all the characters misread the dude's motivations for doing whatever it is he's doing.  Jeffrey Lebowski believes he's trying to rip him off.  Jackie Treehorn thinks he's trying to muscle in.  The detective thinks he's a brilliant sleuth (playing both ends against the middle etc.)  And so on and so on.  Everyone finds it impossible to believe that he's JUST THE DUDE, takin' 'er easy for the rest of us.  Also, why wasn't Jeff Bridges nominated for an Oscar for this?  This has to be his best performance ever, and it stands out among a host of them here.

Every once and a while a true life style movie comes along and you can relate to one or more of the characters.  Well like Homer Simpson all of us has a little "dude" in him.  Thats a good thing we need more Dudes then attitudes in our times.  Although all might not agree with him one gets the feeling of what the films message is and thats what "ties it altogether, did it not! "Grade A"

Review title: The funniest movie I have seen
Review_body: This movie grabs me for so many reasons. First of all I really dig the way the dude handles things. He's just so damned lax about everything. Watching the dude go about his stuff is the perfect antidote for the hustle and bustle of today's overly-corporatised world.The humour of this film is unique and enjoyable because of the strong characterisation of the film. Praise goes to Jeff Bridges for totally immersing himself into his role and really embracing it. The humour of the film can be very subtle at times, and as you watch it and learn more of the dude's habbits, it becomes even better. It's a very detailed film. Support cast was terrific, esp. John Goodman as the rambunctious Vietnam vet. Go see the movie and be amazed at the production, witty (yet unpretentious) dialogue, quirky characters and an amazing soundtrack to boot.

The only movie I watched three times in cinema. Thoroughly funny, John Goodman alias Walter Sobchak is outstanding. The introduction of "Jesus" is one of the highlights in cinema history (although the character itself is as unimportant as the whole bowling matter...the movie even doesn't tell you who won the semis...).

I have never seen a movie that I can watch over and over again and still laugh out loud at every classic moment.  The Big Lebowski does it for me all the way.  Many people told me it was stupid and not funny.  Of course those were the same people who regard American Pie as the funniest movie ever. Not that slapstick comedy doesn't make me chuckle, but I cannot hold a conversation with somebody who thinks Don't Be a Menace to South Central... is a classic.  This movie gets my vote for good wholesome family fun.

The Big Lebowski is a wonderful comedy with a twisting somewhat complex plot not usually found in this genre. John Goodman delivers an especially humorous performance as an Vietnam vet who never really has anything under control and Jeff Bridges plays the slacker "Dude" who gets thrown into an amazing twist of events thanks to merely sharing the same name as a millionaire. Highly recommended if you've never seen it.

Review title: One of the funniest movies of all time!!!
Review_body: Bowling, Beer, and Drugs; what more could you possibly ask for from a movie? How about a show dog(with *&%$#@# papers).  Bowling, as it is meant to be played, is the key element in this movie.  Donny is without a doubt one of the funniest characters in any movie ever made.I love Walter's take no &*^% attitude.  He always has a plan(I also heard that he was in NAM).  He refuses to give in to any opponent, calling them all *&%$#@# amateurs.The Dude.................Need I say more!

This movie I saw for the first time in winter of 1999. I didn't really pay much attention to it because I was tired and I had seen two other rentals prior to this one. I thought to myself, nothing special. Then about a month to a month and a half ago I saw it at the flea market here for sale at $5. There wasn't much else to do or buy so I got it. I watched it again and it blew me away. It is such a well constructed plot with many twists and turns and incredibly well developed and sympathetic characters. I found a new respect for John Goodman's acting abilities. I had always thought that Jeff Bridges was ok but his performance here made his stock go up in my personal opinion. Then you have other people who made the movie a delight like John Turturro, Steve Buscemi, and Julianne Moore. The Coen Brothers have an amazing talent for screenplay writing and I can't wait for their next project. It has even inspired me more to write a little something myself.

With characters ranging from Walter Sobchak, the angry Vietnam vet to Jackie Treehorn, the infamous pornographer, this film has it all. I often find myself repeating lines from this movie to my friends, just because they will be forever impounded in my mind. No matter how many times I watch it, I will still laugh at every scene. For my money, this is the greatest comedy ever produced.This film not only provides non-stop laughter, but it teaches us an important lesson about life. We must adopt the Dude's carefree attitude. This movie teaches us that all you need in life are a few good friends and a recreational activity in which you enjoy greatly, in the Dude's case, bowling was what he enjoyed the most. Whether we put this lesson to use ourselves or not, it's like the Stranger said, `It's good knowin' he's out there. The Dude. Takin' 'er easy for all us sinners.'

The Coen brothers `Big Lebowski' is without a doubt the best comedy movie of all time. Jeff Bridges plays the character of the lazy pot-smoking `dude' so well you actually believe the hilarious remarks he makes are genuine. His friend Walter (John Goodman) is the stereotypical Vietnam vet that manages to relate everything to Vietnam no matter how remote the situation is. This movie is great aphrodisiac after a long stressful day at school or work. Unlike most comedy movies `The Big Lebowski' gets better every time you watch it. I recommend that a person watch it at least twice to get the full effect of the Coen brothers' genius, better yet buy the video or DVD, this movie just keeps getting funnier every time!

Review title: Like all things Coen, incredibly underrated.
Review_body: You know you love them.  Coen movies have that quirky something or other that at times will make you laugh out loud or squirm in your seat, sometimes at the same time.  The only movie I think that doesn't fit this mold was Blood Simple (less funny than the rest).  But it was still VERY good.  Some movies are more funny.  Some are more violent.  But there is always a mixture of the two.  It's refreshing to see movies these days that don't resort to spooge jokes and CGI F/X cheating and hip-hop soundtrax. I'm starting to ramble.  Anyway, I love this movie.  Love, love, love it. When I got a DVD player last fall this was the first movie I bought, and I have watched it on average of once a week since then.  I'm no expert by any stretch of the imagination, but I know a well made movie when I see one. And I know when a writer/director cares for the characters, and it really comes through in this movie.  And it's funnier than anything that's been made in years.  Even After all the times I see it, I still laugh out loud at certain parts.  My wife and I quote it constantly to each other.  My Favorite parts (possible spoilers ahead):1. The scattering of the ashes (It's wrong but it feels oh so right), 2. The Dude in the Eagles Cab (I, too, fervently hate the Eagles) and, 3. The "marmot" in the tub So I recommend to anyone who wants a good laugh and a weird plot with some truly loveable characters, see this movie.  10/10

Every once in a while there comes a movie that leaves you with the feeling that you have witnessed genius. 'The Big Lebowski' is definitely one of those movies. You become entranced from the start by Sam Elliot's opening monologue and it never lets up. On first viewing, the movie can seem slow, confusing, and even boring, but do not let that stop you from seeing it again. 'The Big Lebowski'is an acquired taste. It is very good at first, and after a few more viewings it becomes undeniably excellent. Brilliantly crafted in the style of an old Hollywood mystery, 'The Big Lebowski' is one of the funniest and most original movies of all time. Its craftsmanship is perfect and the actors, notably Jeff Bridges, Phillip Seymore Hoffman, John Torturro, Steve Buscemi, Julianne Moore, and John Goodman, all put up some of the best performances of their careers. The script, by the Coen Brothers, is truly ingenious and its creativity is awe inspiring. There are hilarious subtleties that one only notices after seeing it again and again. I have seen the movie 17 times and it honestly gets funnier each time. 'The Big Lebowski' is truly the greatest movie ever made.

didn't get it the first time i saw it on Christmas eve..bummed out by myself..then i watched it again right after...incredible!! this is the best Cohen bros film yet...and gets better each time...even bought the book about the making of it which shows storyboards, etc... this movie is not to be missed..one of my all time favorites..and I've seen a LOT of movies....check it out...you'll thank me....it rox! enjoy!!! if you like it..check out the making of book. This film has all of the regular Cohen actors...Jeff bridges is amazing and the xtras on the DVD are well worth it...esp the part about Sam Elliott having no idea why he was even hired to show up for his part...anyway...great soundtrack..and great actors...the shooting is so amazing..sets the scenes perfectly...awesome!

Review title: Like good wine... Well, uh, that's just your opinion man...
Review_body: The Dude Abides... See it more than once; it grows on you. It is mythical. First time I saw it, I was not so impressed, others say this also happens to them, but try it again and something unusual will take shape in you. It is like the proverbial "good wine" kind of thing. With age it gets better and better. And you gotta check out the Lebowski Fest web site - a whole community of "Little Urban Achievers" with T-shirts, bumper stickers, Lebowski Fests. This is a classic movie that can "gently like water cracking stone," change the consciousness of the world (I know...,that seems pretty far out... so sue me!) - Yo, abusive world leaders, (and you know who you are...), be warned! - This is a subversive film - you better ban it or classify it and lock it away before your populations learn to relax and enjoy life! You might think it is only about a stoner anti-hero hero, and it is to some extend, but it is also about ordinary people dealing with stuff they ain't prepared for - being a bigger person than you think you are - handling the messy stuff life throws at you without shutting down and becoming rigid. It is about finding your inner-dude... And maybe, just maybe, this particular movie is growing in popularity at this particular time because of the way things are - the pathetic and clueless leaders we have - the direction they are taking us... yuk! - our seeming inability to do anything about it - the endless frustrations of our menu driven impersonal telephone world - and maybe there is also some nostalgia for the 60's and 70's, when for a brief shining moment, there was a sense of real life happening, and a sense of optimism blooming - that is missing today - "well, uh, that's just your opinion man..."

This is one of the funniest movies I have seen. There are more sub-plots in this movie than first meets the eye.  A big bonus for me is that my two teenage boys(ages 17,19)share the same opinion.  Common ground not always found.  Jeff Bridges turns in another great acting job.  The cast is almost to good to be true. The interaction between the "the dude" Donnie and Walter is very special.
Don't ever try to watch this nonsense movie.. Reviewers high rates made watch this.. Too much frustrated
One of the lamest movies I have ever seen. Don't believe the hype.

Review title: Whats happened to the Coen brothers?
Review_body: Just watched the Ladykillers and am most disappointed. Iv'e one question. Whats happened? Fargo, great. Big Lebowski, even better. Since then the Coen brothers have not produced anything that comes close. I don't know why this is but I really wish they could make a movie which is half as good as Lebowski. Stop using A list actors such as Hanks and Clooney and go back to your roots. Jeff Bridges performance as 'the dude' is a joy to behold. Can't imagine Hanks in that role or Clooney as someone who does'nt roll on Saturdays. I can only think that as their movies gained popularity in the 90's they thought they would up the ante and work with big movie stars and have bigger budgets. It has'nt worked! Please ditch all the movie stars and return to the great character driven, quirky movies of which you made your names. Here's hoping...

Review title: the best coen-brothers movie so far
Review_body: first, this movie is must-see-must-have. all the little details, the colorful characters and great music makes it one of those movies you can watch time and time again. the acting is very good all-round, the dialog is just so funny, but most of all, the pacing is just SO right... everything seems to follow naturally, so you cannot help but being drawn in. my favorite coen-brothers movie so far, and a classic movie.

Review title: All the Dude ever wanted was his rug back...
Review_body: Artistic, intriguing, and damn hilarious.  I love this movie through and through.  I always catch something new every time I watch it.  If you haven't seen this movie, get out there and rent it.  You don't know what you're missing.
I've watched this movie in a variety of states of mind, and it's fantastic every time.

This movie is one of just a few comedic masterpieces.  If you don't believe me just watch the scene with Jesus in it bowling.  His dance will make you fall out of your seat.  This is definitely one of the funniest movies I've seen in a long time.

Review title: Weakest link in the Coen chain of films
Review_body: It's not `all that': not all that funny, not all that imaginative, not all that entertaining, etc. It is, however, a disappointing turn by some of my favorite actors - Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, and Steve Buscemi - in a showcase of unrealized potential. Under written and over-acted, this film does nothing but tarnish the sterling reputation the Coen brothers' previous (and subsequent) works accomplish. By far not the worst movie I've ever seen, it just doesn't achieve `must see' status.

Review title: Hilarity and action packed fun for all
Review_body: This film could not be better! This has to be even better than Raising Arizona (Another terrificly witty piece of their's)! I Love the whole cast, sound track, silliness and seriousness! The whole thing was marvelous!! There couldn't have been a better choice of th actor for the "Dude" Jeff Bridges had it down from the very beginning milk drinking scene to the instigation of the whole "mystery"! A few of my favorite scenes being the whole slam dunk and mitterating scene. The degradation of the car. The "Nialist" in the parking lot. The ferret in the bath. Him listening to "The Best Bowling Moments" on a Walkman. The walk along the water with Donny in hand. Just to name a few. And who could forget the little hottie, the Mrs. Lebowski!

While I'm writing this in 2020 as an 18-year old, my favourite movie is still the same one as it was when I first saw The Big LeBowski when I was about 12. Back then I just thought it was hilarious, but when I took a closer look in the years after I came to realise that the dude works in mysterious ways.I think we should all be more like the dude, especially in 2020, and try to live our lives as they come, in stead of constantly being unhappy with what we have or who we are.If you take a good look and try to understand the beauty of this movie, it will bring you a lot of joy for the rest of your life. The dude abides.

This is, by far, my favorite comedy of all time.  The acting is so real and the situation is so insane that it probably has happened somewhere out there.  Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, and John Turturro all give excellent performances and give the movie such depth that you can't help but grow to know and love there characters.  The music is terrific, especially "Just Dropped In" by Kenny Rogers and the New Edition, which is now one of my favorite songs.  This is one of those movie's that, if you carried the script in your pocket, could provide you with a thought provoking and extremely hilarious quote for any occasion.  Truly a masterpiece.

This movie has spurned a cult following in the last two years. Simply quoting lines from this movie to others familiar with it sparks immediate commaradarie.  "Oh, Nice Marmut."  You can't help but chuckle at that. This is one of the best modern day film noirs I have ever seen.  At first glance it's a great comedy, watch it again and you notice it's also a noir, brilliant!   If you like the Cohen brothers watch:  "Miller's Crossing." Other movies that may interest you: "Chinatown" "The Big Sleep"(the cohen's actually based parts of Lebowski on this film, look for the guy in a wheelchair) also "Easy Rider"

This movie is definitely not for everyone; some people hate it and some cannot find it's humor. I find it absolutely hilarious! The casting is perfect and the dialog is fun. I like the way the characters mesh and clash and completely lose their tempers - John Goodman I'm talking to you - well done! It is funny and offensive to some, but I like that kind of movie.Jullianne Moore is so great in role of Maude Lebowski!Steve Buscemi and Philip Seymor-Hoffman also give great performances. Then of course there is "the dude" (Jef Bridges)the most laid back of them all. Be sure to check out his fashion choices (pay special attention to his shoes!) Someone mistakes him for a millionaire and instead of letting the incident go, an insane, dangerous and funny adventure results. How did he get into this mess? Bowling is known to solve all problems. As do White Russians. But watch out for those nihilists.

Review title: Most quotable movie without being annoying
Review_body: The Coen brothers rarely disappoint and this movie is just another shining example of how masterful they are at filmmaking. I have quoted this one more times in my daily life than I can count and always turn to it when I need a good laugh.The dude abides!!

This is probably the funniest film I have ever seen. I can watch it again and again and never get bored. John Goodman in the role of his life. With Big Lebowski the Coen-brothers show that they are probably the best filmmakers in the world, along with Woody Allen.

Review title: HE IS THE DUDE OF THE CENTURY!!
Review_body: i watched this film on T.V, before i watched it i thought it would be great anyway, but after watching i thought it was great. The coen brothers have exceeded themselves once again. The styl, wit and charisam of this film is great. The dream sequences are the most original scenes i have seen....American Beauty eat your heart out! The twisted humour of this film is nothing like i have seen before. everyone should watch this film its great.I can't wait for thier next film 'The man who was'nt there'.

What a lousy overrated, poorly shot and silly written try on parodying some non-existing stereotype the producer invented for the identification of 15 year old white highschool kids that just found out weed is nice. Good cast, mediocre dialog, it never gets really funny. Trust me. I had to go through this hell at least 10 times with some bucketbrain loser of a film fan, who is not actually into good movies.(Angry Review)

Review title: Great Movie if your in the mood for stupid comedy
Review_body: The movie manages to be a lot of things and once and they all contradict each other. the movie is simple yet not. the amount of characters that show up for 30 seconds in this movie and never come back is also astounding. i'd recommend this movie to mostly everyone i'd see but there is absolutely no guarantee everyone is gonna like it. but if they do like it. they're gonna like it a lot. 8/10
Bit late watching this, wish we never bothered. Nothing film, non interesting story and not funny. How this has got rave reviews is beyond me
The depictions of a easy going stoner is very funny to watch.(especially if your high)

i enjoyed watching this movie and i have to say it is just a good movie.it definitely falls into the category of "must see films" due to its very awakening dialogs and its great players. without too much talking about it, i give it 2 thumbs up and if i had more rest a sure they would be up too. a lovely film about one dude who finds him self in the wrong place at the wrong time. Steve Buschmi is great as always, John Goodman gives his thoughts to the situation. and Jeff Bridges in one of his great rolls - as the dude. any one who likes this type of movies will not only see this movie, he will buy an original DVD of the movie to keep in the house. i have seen it at least ten times threw out the years. you never get tired from it.

Review title: Possibly the greatest film of all time
Review_body: Let me start off by saying that I am a big fan of the Coen Brothers works. Films like Fargo, Oh Brother and No Country for Old Men are some of my favourite films. This one is no exception. This is a masterclass in scriptwriting. The way that every single character is fully developed (including the ones that are only in a single scene) is phenomenal. The use of language to portray a lifestyle is poignant. This movie is everything one should expect from a comedy movie

Review title: A stellar film by the Coen brothers
Review_body: I have watched this film multiple times and find it better every time I watch it. With extreme precision every line of the film is spoken in such a quotable way that by the time you are finished with the movie you can't help but make comments about every area rug you come across. I recommend this movie to anyone looking for something to watch and if your reading this review stop wasting your time and watch it already.

It is one of those films which you have to pay attention to ever satiric detail as they unfold. At first you think the movie is simply zany but as the story unfolds you can feel it grab ahold of you and want to rewind to see a given scene again. Bridges and Goodman are so hilarious as the unlikely story unfolds into chaos.
It is definitely a movie that I go back to watching again and again as each time I practically fall off my seat.
Thanks to great cast of actors for making this movie a classic.

Review title: Simply one of the best movie's you will ever see!
Review_body: This movie crosses so many boundaries and limitations that 99.9% of all other comedies limit themselves to. Everything from a carpet p***ing thug to a pervert named "Jesus" that can bowl like no one's business is in this movie. Every scene makes my sides split. The plot rates up there with Akira and The Matrix, simply genius! So many twists and turns with an ending you have to see more than once to believe. Great music all throughout as well. Simply this movie has everything you could ask from a movie including many 1st rate A List actors that do a wonderful job. However do NOT see this movie if you are faint of heart or ears. LOTS of cursing as well as a few violent scenes and a couple nudity scenes as well as a hefty dose of inuendo and sexual jokes. But if you are like most people this will not even phase you and you will love every last line in the movie. I can't think of ANYTHING I would change in the movie.  Props to EVERYONE involved in making this movie, it is 1st rate.
If I would know this movie is so bad, I would not spend two hours on this movie. A continuous change of story to the point where it gets boring and annoying.

Review title: in my top ten of all time greats
Review_body: The Big L is one of the greatest films ever. It captures an ethos/way of life with amazing accuracy & attention to detail. Its comedy is both subtle & clever. words fail me, but it has to be said that those of you who think Fargo is the greater of the two have "lost the plot". I could easily watch this film over and over & still find new hidden gems hidden within (you can't say that about many). I think people have a problem with it cause it has no real beginning or end its  a section in the life of "the Dude" one can really say "it just is". A masterpiece the thesaurus doesn't contain enough words !

It couldn't be funnier , it couldn't be more classic.It should have won Oscars for best Actor(The Dude Jeff Bridges) and supporting Actor(Walter John Goodman),As well as movie of the year. Bunny, Maude, The Jesus , Donnie, Jackie Treehorn, Even Larry (is this your homework Larry?Your killin your father Larry, Have you ever heard of Vietnam Larry?) Classic writing , amazing actors, this will be a movie I'll watch at least a million more times, The only possible problem is THERE SHOULD BE A PART 2. Maudes pregnate , That could be used in so many ways,Lets hope wiser minds can make it so. If it were done I'ed be among the first to line up to see it.

Best comedy ever made. Period. The characters. The setting. The overall feeling. The Cohen brothers knows their craft. I mean, Walter Sobchak, you cant go wrong with a character like that. Especially when you cast John Goodman for the role. And Jesus. Don't forget about Jesus. Never have a character with so little screen time made such an impression. This may sound weird but John Turturro plays the best alleged rapist/self proclaimed bowling king there ever was. And he does it wearing a god damned hair net.I fall back on this movie when i'm sad, when i'm happy, when i'm alone or when i'm with friends. I always fall back on this movie. If i were to choose ONE movie to see for the rest of my life, this would be the one.Plus it always makes me wanna go bowling and get drunk on milk based drinks.

I'll admit I'm a big Coen Brothers fan. The Big Lebowski is arguably their very best. Jeff Bridges and John Goodman, especially, play off each other in a playfully tense, yet loyal and inevitable friendship. Love the movie.

Nothing else than pure genius. I hope you won't stop judging a movie from how many times they use the word f**k, would be really sad if you did so cause you would miss one of the best movies of all times.The Dude, who for some might be a total loser, stands up to the condition of hero, a great amazing slacking hilarious hero. A mention of his own for John Turturro who, despite having a really small part in the movie, comes out with an outstanding interpretation of "Jesus" which would be worth the price of the DVD on its own.What can I say, I love the Coen Brothers and this is without any doubt their best movie so far.If you still haven't seen it give it a shot, you won't regret it!
If you are not really into drugs, there's no point of seeing it. I can picture some dudes being high watching this movie and making sense out of it. I couldn't.The only thing worthed was Sam Elliott.

One of the worst movies I've ever seen. Total crap and not even a bit funny, only when Walter empties the can with Donny in it. It shouldn't be in the top 250. I read the other comments and I don't understand your enthusiasm about it. There in almost no humor in the movie, no decent crime/action where the movie is ranked for. Please help to remove this movie from the top 250. I watched over 100 top250 movies and they were all worthy of a place in this ranking, but this one is such useless crap that it really has to be lowered in ranking. I normally enjoy this genre so it's not that i'm a hater of this type of movies, it's just not a good movie.Please watch it and give a comment, but i needed a second watch to finally make it to the end of the movie. It's boring and once again not worthy for #181 in the ranking.

Review title: Perhaps the funniest movie of all time!
Review_body: Perhaps the funniest movie of all time.  The Coens had always been masters of realistic sounding dialogue, in "Fargo" for example, but this movie puts it over the top.  Having lived in California for many years, it always reminds me of how people talked there; swearing, using "dude", "man", and "f**k", in every sentence, and not really finishing a sentence.  Overall a great movie.

Review title: I laughed, I cried -- well OK, I guess I really just laughed
Review_body: This is one I pull out every year or so and watch and ask "why did I wait so long to watch this one again? There are many scenes and lines that I find run through my head for awhile after I watch this. A number of great performances and it's interesting that over time, this cast looks stronger and stronger. As I watch this movie, it really appears that the cast is having a lot of fun making this film - relationships appear easy and no one seems to have phoned their lines in. I do find that I have to be in the right mood to watch it - it's great release when it's been a particularly stressful week, because in a way there's a lot about The Dude (Jeff Bridges) that appeals - a lot of people would like to be that free, but there's a lot of pent up stress in most people's worlds, like Walter's (John Goodman). Give it a try!

Review title: A celebration of the unique nature of the lazy
Review_body: To say the Big Lebowski is merely a comedy is to disregard what has to be one of the best scripted films to appear during the last 20 years.  Only the Coen Brothers possessed the bravery, foresight and genius to bring this celebration of the slackers and lowlifes to the screen.The strength of the Big Lebowski does not lie in its cinematography or its occasional special effects (which are excellent), but rather in its refusal to conduct itself like any other main stream film.  Repeatedly the film falls back upon the interaction between the characters.  Who can forget the various bowling alley dicussions between the Dude, Walter and Donny?  The way that through one conversation we are able to see deep into the far-out psyche of each character as they strive to plod along in their mudane and under-funder existence.The Coens attention to detail is another prominent feature of the film. Its the little things that count.  Such as the bullishly Jewish Walter's firm which is known as Sobchak Security, or SS for short.  Or maybe the Donnys inability to get a word in edgeways.  I have seen the film many, many times now, and each time I have seen something new, which can only serve as a testament to the Coens abilities as film makers.The plot of the Big lebowski is made so ridiculous that it could only be made 'real' by having a group of completely ridiculous characters.  The Coens refuse to leave even the most incidental character without some kind of strange background or character quirk.  Just see Brandt or the aggressive police sergent for examples.The Big Lebowski serves as a celebration of the lazy and unambitious.  In the Dude we find solace.  He makes you think: Why do i have to bother dealing with things?  Why stress over things that do not matter?As i believe a reviewer in Empire put it:  In an ideal world all films would be made by the Coen Brothers.

This is the Cohen's at their best - and the actors at their best! You put Miller's Crossing, Fargo, and Raising Arizona in a blender and you get the best 'Caucasian' ever made! How many quotes have come from this film? I've never gotten tired of this one. The guy that does the marmot scream used to live down the street from me. His voice is always found in their films. The last time that I talked to him, he was leaving Lexington for the West. He had just finished directing a Doc on 'Grunge Ukulele' musicians in the Pacific Northwest. I think that his most disturbing sound effect was the odd scream of the paid off boxer in Miller's Crossing. That one always makes ya wonder what grandpa's really going to do with the fire stoker when he picks it up on Christmas.

Like many I'm sure, I've watched this movie so many times, I can quote nearly every line. Needless to say, it is one of the most entertaining and laugh-out-loud stories ever told. But, watching it again recently, I was struck by a subtle theme that I hadn't caught on to before: this movie is very seriously advocating peace, in our lives, in our relationships, and on the world scene. It's a little bit discomforting how this "comedy" unintentionally reminds us that we are still fighting in Iraq after over a decade. Not to espouse my political views or suggest that this is a political film, but this film does focus our attention (via the Walter character) on our collective obsession with violence and encourages us to reevaluate our situation from the Dude's perspective: our communication lines are breaking down, "new information has come to light," and like many of the characters in the film, we should be asking, "WTF are we talking about?!" When "this aggression will not stand," the Dude doesn't raise a fist, "the Dude abides" and "takes it easy." The Dude is a "bigger" man; he IS the Big Lebowski.

I never heard much of this movie until a few days ago. I mined the web for some information on it, and it seems like most reviews put it into the 2 to 3 star category. After seeing it, I couldn't disagree more. Not only is this movie hilarious, but it makes a quiet statement about living up to one's own expectations, and about life in general. Not everyone will "get it", as they say, but that's OK! This one has enough laughs to please anyone.

There were parts of this movie that made me laugh so hard, I had to stop watching it to catch my breath.  The actors are so perfect, so precise in their portrayal of their characters, I really feel like I am in So. Cal. in 1991.

Review title: Great movie I recommend it to everyone
Review_body: The first time I saw this film i was young so i didnt really have any interest in it. But when i saw it a couple years later i went straight to the mall and bought it. I cant stop watching this movie. I laugh at every seen even though I've seen it  million times. The Coen bro's made another great movie to bad they dont give Best Picture for comedy's anymore. I think everyone should take a look at this film more than once and have a good laugh. Till next time "The Dude Abides."

Review title: Fortunately I've been adhering to a pretty strict, uh, drug regimen to keep my mind, you know, limber.
Review_body: That classic, one of many, line pretty much sums up the Dude.I cannot rave about this film enough.  Literally every scene is funny, if not downright hilarious.  What I want to know is how the Coen brothers come up with this stuff.  Their comedic writing is pure genius.The casting is outstanding, the acting great, and the direction is right on. Plus it has a awesome soundtrack.If you haven't seen this movie, RUN, don't walk, and buy it.  You will not be sorry.  I don't know why you're still reading this, I said go and buy it!10 out of 10

When I first happened upon this movie I did not yet know what I was getting into. I knew the makers by their previous works but was not yet a fan. The first time I saw it I didn't understand what was going on. The second time I watched it I knew the plot and could therefore concentrate on the subtleties. That is what makes this film greatness. The Big Lebowski is a shining example of what film should be, a perfect marriage of superior quality writing and heart-felt acting from the masters of their respective professions, with an attention to detail unlike any other. Materials of the finest quality mature with age and stand the test of time. This film never gets old and only improves with each sequential viewing the way summer block-busters never can. Take a chance. Give this one another look. Invest ninety minutes of your life into this film.

Great movie, great absence of enormous plot lines. Beautiful characters (with depth). Hilarious at some points, dramatic through situational humor.A great trip to the bowling alley of life. Jef Bridges is in great shape as the Dude, but John Turturro steals the show as the gay bowler. Steve Buscemi plays the same character over and over but he does it so well that all is forgiven.After seeing this movie, your carpet will be cherished, ashes of the departed treated with respect and a night out bowling will be more adventurous...
It's not just another movie... It's a guide of how to live life. Seem a little over the top? Watch it, base your life on it, and enjoy life. Enough Said.

I missed The Big Lebowski when it was at theaters, and after reading all the hoopla and praise foisted in its direction, had to rent it and finally see it.Big mistake.As with Pulp Fiction, I just don't see what the hype is about. The humor is sparse as far as I'm concerned, with John Goodman's character being the only redeeming part of the entire movie.Yeah, I paid attention. And I watched it twice. It didn't help.Some people have raved over the joke that the main character's rug "Really tied the room together". If that is what passes for great humor, well count me out.

when i saw this movie i thought how the hell can this make the IMDb top 250 when it should have been in bottom 250.This film is about a pair of lazy douchebags who are supposed to make you laugh but all they are able to do is make u angry with all their useless talk. Then the hero gets attacked in confusion with a man of same identity and the attackers pee on his rug we are treated to his stupid talk of trying to claim the carpet from the original intended victim and the man throws him out.But unbelievably he employs him as a negotiator when his young wife is kidnapped.Julianne moore in the role of a nymphomaniac looks pathetic.And the hero's friend walter tries to be funny but he falls way short of that and makes you sleep with his boring and brainless talk.And i will not talk about the end but i will say it it's as stupid as the movie itself. So if you want to watch this movie on basis of its high rating you will be hugely disappointed. Avoidable.

Well, Big Lebowski is the only movie I can watch 3 times in a row and enjoy every little scene of it. It has everything an excellent comedy should have - good plot, excellent actors performances, great camera work, music, brilliant dialogues and, most importantly, it is funny and entertaining no matter if watched for second or 1002 time.Be prepared that it will not make you roll on the floor laughing and it not as filled with gags as, say, Naked Gun series. Probably you won't even like it for the first time, or just find it weird. Trust me - just go watch it again. Tiny details are crucial in this movie and on the second view you start to notice and appreciate them.

The movie isn't bad, but as one of the best of all time? Hardly, the scenes were bland, jokes were average and not a highlight of the Coen's career. John Goodman had a small role, the movie may of been more impressive if it wasn't seen as such as masterpiece. Worth watching ill admit but should not be raved about like a Pulp Fiction 2. Judge for yourself but your taste of movies would of swooped to a new low if you consider this as a 90's classic. Fargo, O brother where art thou, Paris... they can be remembered but this was just a standard movie to kill some time. Best 250 films of all time? hardly.. Feel free to comment back but don't blame me if you are utterly disappointed

Review title: A definite classic with superb actors
Review_body: I must admit, that Big L is one of the best films I've ever seen! And believe me, I've seen a few. This is an ultimately cool and strange flick, filled with cool and strange characters.Jeff Bridges in one of the best and most interesting roles in his career as "The Dude". John Goodman gives an unforgettable performance as The Dude's (gun-)crazy friend Walter Sobchak. Superb acting together with great casting make this title a sure classic. Great soundtrack alone makes Big L worth watching (and listening). Well-written, well-directed and well-produced. If you like other films by Coen-brothers, be sure not to miss this!

This movie is simply amazing. I've watched it for the first time in 1998 or 1999, and to be honest, I wasn't very pleased. I thought:It's OK,quite nice, but nothing special. Three years ago I watched it again, and I found it much better. But that wasn't still it.Finally I watched The Big Lebowski for the third time last year and I was really amazed.Maybe I could say "third time's a charm", I don't know, maybe I was to young in 1998 to understand and enjoy the brilliance of The Big Lebowski or maybe it's that kind of movie which keeps getting better and better each time you watch it. It is one of my favorite movies, there's something magical about it.You can watch each single scene over and over again and not get bored. The dialogues are hilarious,but I am aware of the fact, that not everybody would like that kind of humor, but I just love it! Magnifficent performance from all actors, especially Bridges, Goodman, and Buscemi.But supporting Seymour Hoffman, Stormare or Moore are outstanding too. I' ve read that when Cohens wrote the script they had all these actors in their mind and You can see it on the screen! Simple "A must see"!But of course, you know, that's just like my opinion man...Anyway the Dude abides!

Review title: My Favorite comedy of all time
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is quite simply my favorite comedy of all time. It won't be for everyone and I can understand why some may find it a fairly odd film. Lets be honest... It is slightly odd but absolutely hilarious. John Goodman is fantastic as always and in my own opinion Jeff Bridges puts in his finest display ever as the laid back Lebowski. Steve Buscemi is... Well, Steve Buscemi but is perfect for his role.I don't feel all Coen Brother fans will love this as much as I do as I feel in many ways it is quite different from much of their other work. If I had to liken it to any of their previous work I would have to say the film 'The Naked Man.' Although as a Coen Brother fan myself It happens to be my personal favorite.Fans Of films such as 'Spinal Tap' and 'Withnail & I' will surely love this film. Just think, Students all over the world will be watching this film right now remembering various quotes to use from the film tomorrow. This may sound ghastly but hey... This film proves students do have taste after all:-D

The Big Lebowski is a movie to watch again and again - and yet enjoy its subtle humour and great atmosphere everytime. The Coen Brother's truely are great filmmakers - constantly providing us with witty, original scripts and deep memorable characters.The Big Lebowski - as with all the Coen films - is driven by sharp dialogue and excellent characters. The 'Dude' is the personification of laziness acted to perfection by Jeff Bridges, always wearing the same tatty clothes and hilariously drinking a milky White Russian "Hey man i got a beverage here!" We first meet the Dude in a shopping mall - with milk on his moustache - hilariously writing a cheque for 69cents! John Goodman is the Jewish Vietnam veteran Walter Schobchek - taking every opportunity to shout about his dead 'buddies' from the war and shout at Donny (Steve Buchemi). Donny is a quiet man with very little impact on the narrative - however the comedic relationship between him, Walter and the 'Dude' is a charm.The atmosphere created here gives superb viewing, with top notch cinematography and genuine, if obscure, relationships between the odd characters. But what you will remember most from this film are the hilarious quotations - "F*** it dude, let go bowling", "Well thats just, like, your opinion man!" and "Obviously your not privy to the new s**t, man" to name just a couple.

Review title: There is no film around that better explores white Russians and bowling.
Review_body: The Big Lebowski is frankly a terrific entertaining film.  When discussing the Coens and their output usually people jump all over Fargo or O, Brother Where Art Thou?.  I cannot fault them for this, as these are great movies. But I have always been drawn to those films that follow the bigger hits. The Big Lebowski wedged between the aforementioned Coen Brothers movies fits quite nicely.  The plot doesn't really matter.  It assuredly does twist and turn and is incomprehensible at times.  As this film is a take on the film detective genre, most notably The Big Sleep which doesn't make sense either, this is extremely acceptable.  Take the Bogart character that has all the answers out of the plot and place a burned out broke bowler that loves white Russians in his stead, throw in John Goodman, Steve Buscemi, Juliane Moore, Philip Seymour Hoffmann, and a funny, well-executed story and you have The Big Lebowski.  All-in-all, I would say about 3 stars out of four.

The funniest movie of all time one of the BEST movies of all time. I have never laughed so hard in my entire life. The Coen brothers truly are geniuses. Jeff Bridges gives an incredible performance (K-Pax eqsue) and the combo of John Goodman, Steve Buscemi and John Tuturro makes it awesome. And as an added bonus we get a sexy looking Tara Reid and an even sexier (if it is possible) Philip Seymour Hoffman.

Either you're life is going to be changed by it, or you're missing the whole point. A truly amazing observation on life, espacially on how to take it easy. Life is very simple and beautiful when you think and act like the Dude, even if they seem to get pretty much complex. Just sit back and enjoy the ride. Long live the dude!

This movie is superb. Easily one of the best. It's big, funny, sprawling. It never gets old. The comedy is superb. The characters are awesome. And it's a really good, entertaining take on Los Angeles. Superb.It's the Coen's at their best. You could argue they make two types of movies - the dark thriller and the absurd comedy. This (with a close second being Raising Arizona) is by far their most interesting work.I could spend the rest of this just quoting lines, but I'm not going to. If for some reason you haven't seen this movie, stop whatever you are doing and go rent it.

One day in school worldwide, when list of the movies that pupils have to see will be written your should definitely expect the Big Lebovski on ti. The manner and style of acting, the complexity of the story and rhythm of the film offer you unforgettable pleasure. It is a film that you will be back to regularly. If it happen to you not love it at first view, give him a few more chances. Think and consider each character separate and feel why this movie is admired around the world and have acquired the status of a cult film. Must see movie. The movie. TheBigLebovsky. So, without further writing a film that certainly should not be bypassed. I would be very happy if I haven't seen this movie to watch it once more and open my self a pleasure of watching it for first time. If you have seen it yet you are a lucky person. Enjoy.

Review title: The one reason to drink white russians
Review_body: The absurdity, the coolness, and the essence of just being are present in a cocktail of so like the brothers Coen.At first I didn't want to go to see this movie as I am not into "lazy time wasting slackers" or bowling.  I know now that I have truly underestimated the importance of bowling, and that God is in the details.

This movie was good but by no means a master piece. The plot tried a bit to hard to be cleaver and the humor wasn't the best. The acting was good by all involved with the exception of Julian Moore who's acting was sub par. Worth a watch but don't go in expecting too much. I saw this in 2017 so maybe at the time the movie was better and doesn't hold up to more modern takes on similar story.

Can someone explain what was funny about this movie?  I know I am in the minority, but I just don't get it.  I found it predictable and annoying. I just wonder what I missed.  Anyone have a clear explanation ?

Review title: The best film the Cohen Brothers ever made
Review_body: Frankly, this is the best film the Cohen Brothers ever made, it shows their strength at doing comedy, which frankly is what they do best.It's not a comedy of gags, nor one in which every line is tailored to achieve an effect. It's an intelligent script, fine tuned to make you laugh while you try to catch the underlying message.Every character fills the movie with flavor, while Jeff Bridges as The Dude and John Goodman as Walter Sobchak lead the cast, some lesser characters such as Philip Seymour Hoffman's Brandt and John Turturro's Jesus Quintana help to change the pace in the movie.This is one of this movies you watch and like, and after some time you see again and find a lot of small little details you missed the first time.It's definitely on my top 10 movies of all time, a must see.

No film has disappointed me as much as this one did. I walked out of the theater swearing I would never watch another Coen Brothers film as long as I lived. I felt insulted. It was like they were giving us all the middle finger, saying "Here's some mindless crap for you. Enjoy your Happy Meal."I had come to expect so much more from a Coen Brothers film. Now they were just cashing in on Fargo and making something that would finally generate a mountain of cash. The whole thing was nothing more that a giant commercial to sell a soundtrack.It was the same old cast (John Goodman yelling...again). The script is rug thin. And the characters are some of the most shallow and unlikable stereotypes to ever appear on film. (Happiness, I'm looking at you.)The movie has it's moments, but for people to rate it higher than Raising Arizona almost angers me. The Simple mention of this film still raises my Blood pressure.

Does this film, Big Lebowski, presage the 911 Tragedy even though it was produced in 1998, 3 years before the tragedy? If it does, what does that imply ? Let us first examine the evidence that support that this film does indeed presage the 911 Tragedy.What evidence is there to support this claim you ask ? EVIDENCE that will SUPPORT the CLAIM: Jeff Bridges dates a check for half & half creamer with the date of September 11, then the camera immediately pans to a TV broadcast of King George Herbert Walker Bush the 1rst, decrying the aggression Saddam was green-lighted by US Ambassador to UN April Glasbie under the direction of King George I to attack Kuwait as this was their concern, not ours. Glasbie to Saddam: "has no opinion on inter-Arab disputes such as your border dispute with Kuwait." Effectively double crossing their agent Saddam just as they did their foolish change agent & Prescott Bush protégé and financial aid recipient Hitler.Also in the film there is a scene where a man working the shoe rack @ a bowling alley, an obvious double of Saddam, points to the number 11 on a giant tower of a shoe rack stretching up to the moon.You be the judge.simply Youtube "911 Hidden in Hollywood"

Review title: The only review you need to read on The Big Lebowski
Review_body: It's a really funny, solid movie. I totally think you should watch it if you haven't seen it... and if you have, then I'll see you at Lebowskifest in Seattle, 2010.Goodman's crowning achievement in acting. Bridges delivering lines with the white Russian in his mouth. Poor Donnie. Everything about this one screams "New Classic", which can be said of many of the Brothers' other films.But this has all been repeated Ad-nauseum; I am simply trying to stretch this to 10 lines so I can submit it.So stop reading this! Go watch it if you haven't seen it, you won't be sorry.

you get so much inspiration out of this movie, I saw the comments of this movie and there were the quotes. I read them and have to laugh again and again what a great movie is this. Absolutely a great end of the moive, with the best laugh of the night.

There is not much I can add to the vast array of comments and praise out there for the Dude. However, I would like to note a bit of surreal trivia from the movie.In the opening scene we see the Dude buying milk at the grocery store, nothing special you might be thinking; but when he goes to pay a the register, note the Date of the Check he is writing and the news-clip on TV immediately afterwords...It is Chilling to say the least, I'll not say more, simply watch the movie once more to witness one of the more bizarre cases of premonition by chance. (10 years to the Date!) By the way, the Box set for this movie is Fantastic--lots of goodies! p.s. How I love the Coen Bros. and all the fine talent they cast in their movies. Three Cheers!

Review title: Don't watch this movie - read below before watching (No spoilers)
Review_body: Okay. So read so much about this movie on internet and the ratings of 8.2 really will make anyone to watch this movie. How do I tell you, how many times did I see my watch and waited that something will happen in the movie. I waited that somehow, someway the movie will pick up its pace. Plain movie with no characters you will feel to remember. All foolish guys with no remarkable dialogs. Stupidity with no humor. So the clear hint is don't ever ever watch this movie if you liked "Snatch" or "Fight Club" etc. Do watch if you liked moves like "The lost highway","Brazil","Kiss kiss bang bang" and other such crazy movies. Take my words..if you don't obey the above hint...you are to suffer... 2 points for I laughed may be twice between 2 hours. There should also be a FAQ section explaining the movie cause even though I understood all mind-fck movies(and I really liked many), this one has clearly made me frustrated all day. I guess, this one is really for the Americans cause may be there are cultural jokes which only the Americans willunderstand. Really hoping that the people all over the world give genuine ratings to this movie so that others can avoid getting fooled.

Review title: feel good movie, laughter with friends the best medicine!!!!!!!!
Review_body: gotta love every minute of this movie. extremely well written and by far the best of all Coen films and they have made some good ones. love watching this film with friends after a night at the bars; always brings a smile to our faces. for all of us that take life too seriously, watch this and feel comfort.abiding in Chicago

Review title: Can there be a best film ever?
Review_body: Yes, it can. Watch the film at least 3 times! I watched it over 25 times. Ever time I watch it, I discover something new.
